Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Oakleigh22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights (2 adults and 3 teenagers). Hotel staff were friendly and the rooms were of a good standard. The breakfast was also good but the restaurant can get a bit crowded. Universal studios and city walk is just 10 minutes walk away. LA traffic can be a bit of a nightmare, so use the metro which is just 5 minutes for from the hotel. We used it to go to the staples center and to the Kodak theatre and could not fault it ($1.50 for single journey or $5 for a day pass). Other reviewers have stated have a room facing the pool to avoid traffic noise, we had a room on the opposite side to the pool and we could not hear any traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Universal”
Reviews.Author: ddclean
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very clean. It's not like the Universal Hotels in Orlando, but for convenience to Universal Hollywood - perfect. Everyone we had dealing with was very courteous and friendly. The Valet Service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Elevator Experience”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler034
Reviews.Content: This hotel has far too few elevators for its size and the few that exist are slow and inefficient. On vacation days lots of famiiies are trying to check out with luggage at the same time. The experience was extremely frustrating. Some guests actually gave up and changed plans or walked down several flights of stairs with luggage. We ended our 20-minute elevator wait by going up to the top floor from the 8th just to get into an elevator. Thus, it was full for others trying to get down. Our shower was also broken, with a leak that sprayed over the curtain and all over the bathroom. We would have imformed staff, but were so late getting out, we did not have time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: gfgb78
Reviews.Content: I stay have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few months and the service is always amazing. The valet, front desk, restaurant, and club lounge staff are all very responsive and friendly. This hotel is very clean and is a great location. This is great hotel for both business and personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hixona
Reviews.Content: We had booked a different hotel for this part of our vacation and it did not work out. The Sheraton was able to give us 2 nights during a very busy spring break and saved our vacation. Emecka checked us in and turned our frowns upside down. The room was clean and quiet. It overlooked the pool and we were able to see the Next Top Models line up for auditions, which was fun. The rooms on our floor were having new room photos and mirrors installed at the time we were there, but they were quick. Starbucks coffee in-room and in the lobby. Convenient shuttle to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: anapin
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Sheraton Universal. At this time, we had a Club Lounge room and we could see the hotel was remodeled , but the staff still do an excellent job. From your arrival, the front desk people, the concierge and everybody that works there pamper you . If you need an information, they give you a complete map, explaining very well all the stuff you need. The breakfast was fair, with eggs, ham, cheeses, breads and muffins, coffee, tea and juices. Also they offer cereals and fresh fruits. You really don't need to have breakfast anywhere else. On the other hand, the happy hour - between 5;30 and 7;00 P.M. - is good if you don't drink alcohol. Soft drinks are free but you have to pay (and it's expensive) for any glass of wine or beer. As we can see, it's an unhappy hour.... But the appetizers were very good, mainly the shrimp appetizer.... Also to get the Port of Los Angeles you have to do a long trip - more than 50 minutes ! and if you call the Supershuttle, you have to go first to the Airport, and then, to the Port... The best thing is: you are almost facing the Universal Studios Hollywood! So, you can choose different things for dining and you don't need to have a ticket to go to Citywalk... If you like the rides, you can spend the whole day for fun... At Citywalk you can shop and dine, isn't lovely? The real problem we had at the hotel was with neighbors screaming, running and slamming doors at 1:30 A.M. I tried to knock the wall, asking for silence and they began knocking the wall like mad people. I called the reception and less than one minute ( the time to get the lift) I've heard the security calling the neighbors and I've got silence to sleep... I liked very much the readiness of the security...

Reviews.Title: “Great location if visiting universal studios”
Reviews.Author: xj_me_leex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a visit to the surrounding studios- universal warner brothers etc. near metro station however we had a hire car, parking quite steep $18 per day but close to Hollywood boulevard 10 mins, hollywood sign 5 mins, beaches 30mina and airport Lax 30-40 mins. Rooms quite basic room, shower, tv. Clean, just what you need for a place to stay, if you are looking for something luxurious this is not it. We may have this view as we had stayed in very luxurious hotels in Vegas and sanfrancisco in the same trip prior to arriving at this hotel. Hotel lifts were a nightmare took 15 mins just to get a lift that wasn't full but apparently it was fully booked this weekend. Breakfast buffet had variety of choice worth including when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wild_Orchidz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Universal Studios and the City Walk. Guest service was impressive. Rooms were beautiful. Location fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paypay14
Reviews.Content: Loved our Stay at the Sheraton Universal City. The staff was wonderful, the lobby is fun and hip. Lots of space to just hang out and relax outside of your room. The restaurant down stairs was wonderful. They have a great breakfast buffet, $21.00 adult, $11.00 for kids 12 and under. Wonderful service (Thanks Roman and Julieanne) It is walking distance to city walk and universal, the sub station is right at the bottom of the hill. Close to everything in LA. I have stayed at the Hilton in the past, but the atmosphere here was way more my style and If they continue to treat guest as well as they treated us they will do well.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: DrDSM
Reviews.Content: I returned again for a yearly convention. Last year I had only one complaint about a dirty bed. This year everything was not just better it was remarkably better. The room was very clean and the staff was the most pleasant I have EVER experienced. Every single staff member was cheery and honestly cared. Not the fake smile one is often greeted with. Another surprise was the prepared lunch. I had the veggie option and it was delicious. Two things to watch out for; 1 is the elevators. Sometimes the traffic gets very heavy and it might take a while to catch one. Just plan ahead. 2. When the outside temperature drops below 53F, the A/C turn into a heater. This doesn't make a lot of sense since the windows don't open and the room temperature then becomes over 80F at 3 a.m. Kudos to the manager and staff for exceeding my expectations by a long shot. But please update the A/C situation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here not to visit Universal Studios but because we had a family member nearby. We arrived late and tired. I travel a lot around the world and around the country, and I had expected this to be just another chain hotel experience, but I have to say that management at this hotel is doing an excellent job because every (not just all, but EVERY) staff member we met was dedicated to satisfying the customer. The room was very nice, the bed was beautiful, but the staff were the best part, from the front desk, to the staff at the bar late at night, to the housekeeping staff who brought us extra pillows, to the staff in the breakfast cafe, to the car valet who helped my wife - thank you to all for a pleasant experience. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when visiting Universal studios”
Reviews.Author: jacqui o
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here and the staff were very welcoming. We stayed in the club level which included breakfast. The breakfast was good but there were not enough seats/tables for all the guests- it got very crowded. The pool is adequate and kept the children happy for an hour or so. The location is also a winner- you can walk from the hotel to Universal Studios and Universal city and hotel parking is reasonable. Our first experience in a Sheraton hotel and after this I would definately stay in a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 teenage sons stayed at this location for 2 nights in March '12. Having stayed at many Sheraton's all over NA I was unsure what the service level would be like in a tourist location being next door to a theme park. We were literally pampered at every level of contact within the property. Breakfast staff were attentive and cheerful. Evening drinks in the lounge (just mom and dad of course) was terrific and the staff again was very social and fun. Business center was state of the art and even the hotel wifi worked well. The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, and I loved the shower head so much I am changing mine at home. A special shout out to one of the front desk managers, Sam. She took great care of us and made us feel like we were more important than anyone else. I found it impressive because in a property that boasts high turnover day to day it takes a dedicated team member to make people feel that way in such a short time frame. Thank you Sam and we are already talking about when our next trip there will be. Regardless of whether we visit universal we will stay at this Sheraton. Regards, Gary, Shelley, Justin & Jordan.

Reviews.Title: “Update on our stay in November 2011”
Reviews.Author: swills9
Reviews.Content: Just a quick update on our review for November 2011, having been in contact with the Manager (Randy) he has promised to make sure we will be OK next time, which will be Feb 2013! Will keep you to this Randy, I see in one of the replies he says it is a 'secure' car park, sadly not 'that' secure, on our last visit, our rental car had the number plate (licence plate) bent upwards by 90 degrees, not much, but annoying all the same, but we did not mention it, when we took it back, the rental co, did ask, but we said we knew nithing about it, and must have been in a supermarket! Hoping for a really nice room next time (Randy !!!) nive and high with a good view, this Hotel can't be that bad, although we have had 'issues' this will be our 5th or 6th stay with them :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: schamp1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a Christmas time visit to see our daughter in Los Angeles. I am Starwood Preferred and they were haveing a great promotion based on your birth year. So, the older you are the better they rate. This hotel offered a nice clean room at a better than average rate in North Los Angeles area. The staff in the hotel were very helpful especially the morning waiters in the restaurant. I think his name is Roman! Very nice man. He made you feel like you were having breakfast at home. No complaints!!! Good Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: Stewart C
Reviews.Content: It is simple but nice, with a great lobby and bar. The fitness area is huge and new but the pool was less than amazing. My room was clean and had a great view of the valley and the theme park across the way. The entire staff was very friendly and outgoing. I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Universal”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay in LA we spent time at 3 different Sheraton hotels. This one was the best. It had the most comfortable (newest?) beds and was very convenient to area attractions. While checking in I mentioned to the desk clerk that I needed to ship souveniers home. Without my asking he immediately googled a local FedEx storefront location and printed driving directions for me. This little step was a very nice touch that really helped me. My wife was also very impressed with this hotel and we both would stay there again if in the area. She agreed it was the nicest one we stayed at during our vacation, even though it appeared to be the oldest of the three. It was well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ITGOA
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best thing about this hotel is it's proximity to Universal Studios and Citywalk. A 5-10 minute walk, or there is a shuttle which we did not try. The Hilton is actually 2 minutes closer. Would stay here again for this reason alone. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We overlooked the pool with a balcony, not sure if this was an upgrade or not for SPG status, the check in person was not particularly forthcoming. We were also given Club Floor access when I asked, which translates to a continental breakfast in quite a busy room. Rooms are well furnished though on the small side. Cons: There is essentially a $30 a night surcharge to stay here. $18 for parking (not discussed at check in) and $10 for internet - with taxes is $30. I hate being nickel and dimed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: dingmax
Reviews.Content: Universal CityWalk and Universal Studio are within walking distance if you do not want to use the shuttle bus service provided. For those driving, the Hotel has easy access to Hwy110 and Hwy 134, you just cannot beat such a location. However, this establishment shows aged even though it claims to have a million dollar renovation recently. We are offered a connecting room and can hear clearly the TV noise from next door, not to mention the sound of excitement from kids during check-in time at around 2-3pm. The Club Lounge is packed with family groups at morning breakfast, you do not enjoy food there but have to fight for it. We checked out after a three-night stay and found the Hotel double-charged us on "Club Access", everything is not up to Sheraton Standard that we expect.

Reviews.Title: “No better than average”
Reviews.Author: mkhmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference but brought along family. The only claim to fame is the proximity to Universal Studios and to get there on foot you have to take an iffy elevator up to the Hilton Hotel next door and walk through their ballroom area to get outside. Crazy. The elevator stuck twice while we were there. Not good. Checked in and the room was ready. No washcloths so immediately called down for some - they never arrived. Next morning called again and finally got some. No extra toilet paper so we were very careful. LOL Concierge was helpful and sold us Universal Studios tickets with no fuss. They have a Starbucks "outpost" in the lobby, but it's part of their actual bar. The person didn't make drinks, just pointed me to the filled canisters lining the booth and I made my own. Weird. The restaurant downstairs has a breakfast buffet that I really enjoyed. It was pricey, but the waitstaff was incredibly nice. Told the kids what they should do at Universal Studios and in what order and they were right! The restaurant makes their own salsa, so if you go, be sure to ask for that - it was phenomenal! I put it on the scrambled eggs from the buffet and really really loved it. Buffet had just about everything you'd want and ended up being cheaper than ordering off the menu. Probably wouldn't stay here again, but wasn't horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, great location for universal and surrounding la area”
Reviews.Author: kenuga
Reviews.Content: Used points: Starwood gold member. Hotel was pretty large, heated outdoor pool kids enjoyed. Requested high room with view., was honored. Room 1608. Rooms seemed to have been updated and were comfortable for our family of 4. Walked and took free van to universal city walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: vamartinez05
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here in a suite and it was amazing! The room was big considering we have a 15 month old baby. Plenty of room for him to run around. Great views from the 14th floor. The pool was great temperature considering the weather was cold. Close to Universal City Walk and Universal Studios which we walked to both days. This is our second time here, and we will always continue to come back here each time we are in the area. The managers and staff are very helpful and always there to assist. Thank you again Sheraton for making our stay again memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Universal Studios then this hotel is a good choice. The location is great, the staff is friendly and the lobby is very beautiful, BUT the rooms are very average. The bathroom was so small that you had to close the door to use the toilet. There were no toiletries, not even a shower cap. Finally, we had a great view, but the windows were filthy. I don't think this hotel deserves a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Facelift Please”
Reviews.Author: Whis117
Reviews.Content: in the land of plastic surgery and re-inventing oneself, why oh why can't the Sheraton Universal get a little love. The front desk staff was awesome, but the rooms are completely dated, bathrooms are microscopic and the place actually kind of smells bad! As I said , the staff is wonderful and try to overcome the condition of the property. The place simply needs an update - please - spend a buck on paint and carpet...

Reviews.Title: “Redone Hotel at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: raysb
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been remodeled and is very nicely appointed, large pool good fitness facility walk or shuttle to Universal Studios Citywalk for a good selection of shopiing and restaurants. Convenient to Hollywood or downtown LA. Close to Burbank airport. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ruthfa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Feb 2012. We arrived at 2345 at night after a lond flight and there was no food availiable within the hotel (not even a vending machine). Front desk suggested we send out for pizza. We were assigned a room that the reception staff assured us was one of their better rooms as it had a balcony. On arrival at the room the main thing we noticed was the noise from the freeway outside the balcony (not sure why you would ever want to sit on it and overlook the traffic). The problem was that the glass patio window was not airtight and not at all soundproofed so the noise from the freeway was loud at all times. We phoned back to reception and asked if there was an alternative room availiable. We were told that no, the whole hotel was fully booked out. We were also told that we should be grateful for having the balcony as people who were higher up were always complaining it was too hot and the air conditioning did not work - at least we were able to cool the room down via the badly fitting windows. We then wondered what kind of run down place we were staying at. The room itself was great, really comfy bed, lots of storage and a good bathroom. Breakfast was adequate though the buffet area was very small (for the size of the hotel) and continously ran out of stuff. Service was erratic, one morning we were waiting so long for our drinks we had already finished the food. Its an OK place, the room is comfortable. Just avoid the traffic facing rooms with the balcony (on ground level floor 3) or the hot rooms in the tower (as reception suggested). Free wireless internet was a bonus also.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: grandmaB47
Reviews.Content: We spent the long President's Day weekend at the Sheraton while in LA to visit our son. The hotel is located in an area with easy access to the freeway. This made it convenient to visit a variety of locations in LA County. The first night there we had a delicious dinner at the hotel restaurant, Californias, although the menu is somewhat limited. The service at the restaurant was superb! The restaurant validated parking for my son. The quality of the bed and pillows was wonderful. Our room was quiet and looked out over the courtyard and the hills. The bathroom needed updating and deep cleaning. The ice machine on our floor was not working and there were problems with the elevators. The young woman who checked us in was extremely professional and check in was very fast. Even with the problems with the ice and the elevators, I would stay here again due to the outstanding service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of the stars?”
Reviews.Author: RustyRobear
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if real stars have actually stayed here, but it was good enough for me. The proximity to CityWalk and Universal Studios was nice for getting out and away from the hotel during free time (I was there for work). I don't know when the rooms were remodeled, but they still had a pretty fresh feeling to them. The lobby was also very nice and good for hanging out in groups. I thought that we would have been a little closer to actual "Hollywood" attractions, but they were only a short ride away. I'd stay at the Sheraton Universal again if I was in the area for any reason, or if I wanted to take my family to Universal Studios during a SoCal vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: nhhk
Reviews.Content: A short walk to Universal, and short distance to many of the sights makes this an excellent place to stay. The rooms are clean and functional. The staff friendly. The staff did more than you'd expect from a Sheraton. The room I was in had a noisy neighbour and the staff went out of their way to move me. Then checked the next couple of days to be sure. The only negative comment about the whole place was that the bar served the worst gin and tonic I've ever had anywhere. Won't take much to fix that! I look forward to staying again next time I'm in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice Sheraton hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManDanny
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at Sheraton Universal after a couple days in Disneyland and our engagment! A great stay this hotel has a beautiful lobby, free internet via wireless or desktop in their Link@ setup in the lobby. Nice restaurant for breakfast, lunch, dinner and room service. Universal is about a five minute walk away so fine if the weather's fine, otherwise there is a shuttle bus that runs from Universal. I wouldn't say the walk is any farther from Sheraton than Hilton though. We were up on the 16th floor facing north in a corner suite. Nice view and enjoyable surroundings. Clean and well presented room. The bed was amazing!! Best sleep we had had all trip. Went for a swim the next morning but it was pouring and pool/hot tub is outside so that brought an end to that! Perfect Starwood stay - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a Theme Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights to complete a Starwoods platinum challenge. Front desk staff very friendly but had a little trouble explaining just what the club floor rooms actually were - it was simple question but really seemed to stump the staff - was finally told the rooms were a little bigger than your standard room. Upon walking into my very small and a bit outdated room (espcially the bathroom), I felt sorry for those not staying on a club level as the room was very small so the non-club level rooms must be tiny. The television was smaller than any TV I have seen in the last three years in any hotel (travel a lot for business so I am out 1/2 of each month). The bathroom, as mentioned, could use an upgrade as well offering some new towels as the towels were very thin and frayed. To be honest, I have never stayed in a Sheraton and am comparing this to a Starwoods Westin so maybe this is not a fair comparison. After night one, thought about checking out and going up the hill the Hilton but then went to the fitness center. The fitness center is one of the best ones that I have been in a hotel outside a hotel giving you a pass to a local health club. The fitness center alone kept me at the hotel all 4 nights. Good to see that the Sheraton understands that business travellers do work out and like to have a wide variety of cardio and weights to choose from. Asked my business asscociate staying at the Hilton about their work out facilities (she is also an avid fitness person) and she was not impressed so I stayed put for the four days. The executive lounge is nothing to write home about. It is your standard lounge - did find it strange that they did not offer coffee or soda throughout the day but perhaps this is because this is more a family/tourist hotel versus a business hotel (?). Not sure I would stay here again on business. When it was booked I chose it due to the challenge and to be near my business associates staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tom1c
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel with fantastic surroundings easy access to the metro train system nice rooms nice breakfast very friendly staff couldn't have asked for more would love to go back and stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jin H
Reviews.Content: We actually checked out of another hotel to come to Sheraton but were very disappointed- should have stayed put where we were. We paid for a room that was supposed to be a more 'desirable' room because it had a balcony facing the pool- we were told by the reception " people pay more for this room". Firstly, to get to the room, one has to go up some 4-5 steps or so- there are no elevators to go to this part of the hotel- not good if you have some heavy luggages. Upon entering the room, we noted the carpet was stained in several areas (see pic). We then realized the wood panel on the door frame to the toilet was almost falling off (see pic). We went back to reception to ask for a different room but was told there were no other rooms available that were equivalent to the price of the room we paid. We were offered a room without a balcony but there will be no refund or upgrades. The receptionist went to speak with his supervisor and came back with nothing except the reassurance that his supervisor will follow up with us; of course no one followed up during our 2 night stay! The parking is shabby not attached to the hotel, you have to walk across a lane to the hotel for $15/night and the parking elevator smelt of urine. Room comes with 3 towels- there were 4 of us (2 kids) and so we asked housekeeping for more towels- they were prompt and brought us 4 extra towels but unfortunately 3 out of 4 towels were heavily stained (see pics). It was disgusting, adding to our disappointment. The only good thing was it's location if you are going to Universal Studios. You will be within walking distance to US. We were very disappointed especially considering it was a Sheraton. Will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: downAMDsouth
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel was nice, clean and friendly staff. The Room was spacious,beds was great. 4 Adults were comfortable in this room. Our View was very good, you could see Hollywood Blvd.(at nite the lights looked great) the hills in a distant, down delow you can see the different studios. The Location was a plus!!! All the attraction were just a short walk. Room service was good, food (breakfast) fresh, hot. Staff at front desk very friendly, most helpful. Yes, I would love to stay again. P.S. the hill was great walking excerise. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Great service......”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service........ I have stayed in countless hotels almost always luxury oriented places like Ritz Carlton or Peninsula. I can honestly say that the accommodations and more importantly the service at the Sheraton universal city was the best I have had. We stayed in the vice presidential suite which was very reasonably priced considering its ample size and magnificent panoramic views. The hotel was well kept, clean, and the food was great.Â  Perhaps what stood out the most was the exceptional service from the moment I walked in the door. The entire staff was courteous, generous, and always willing to go the extra mile to assure our comfort. I come from an industry where client service and small "value adds"set you apart from everyone else.Â  The front desk manager, Sam, truly knows how to enhance a guests stay and was a very very large part of why our stay was so perfect. She personally saw to it that I never had to ask for anything. Also worth mentioning is the fantastic gentleman, Billy, from Californians restaurant. Billy was a delight and we made a point to sit in his section for breakfast daily. Finally, Fernando and Dai from the concierge went above and beyond helping to set up limo and town car needs for me as well as tickets for universal studios and madame tussauds.Â  Overall, I give the hotel a 12 out of 10!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCWife
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is quite out of the way for most So Cal attractions, if you're going to Universal and don't mind being out of the way, it can be the perfect spot. A shuttle is by every 10 minutes during the day to take you to Universal and City Walk where restaurants, shops and attractions abound. The hotel itself is very clean, a little old, but well maintained. Rooms are spacious and updated, the lobby is large and the lobby bar is a great place to grab a cocktail and appy before heading out (especially for happy hour during the week)!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the location, but in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiShu
Reviews.Content: Obviously close to Universal Studios, but not much to offer beyond that. We stayed in a junior suite which was nothing more than a regular room with some oddly placed extra space added on ('L' shaped room). Rooms are run down and in need of a renovation. Service seemed alright - with one exception. In the club lounge, watched a kid playing with the ice cubes intended for drinks with his hands and then putting them back in the bucket The club lounge attendant also watched this. I would have thought that the attendant would have changed out the ice? Nope. Needless to say, warm drinks that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Members”
Reviews.Author: BigD19
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel and was very impressed with the level of service from all staff members. From check-in late on a Saturday night til checkout on Christmas morning everyone was totally responsive - front desk, valet, housekeeping, buffet attendants, even parking lot attendants. If I asked for something it was handled within 10 minutes. The only complaints would be the noise from the toilet tank running on and off all night long and the $18 per night for self parking (a bit high). They did do a repair to the toilet which helped but keeping the door closed at night handled the noise problem. The breakfast buffet (Club level) was good with sufficient choices and the staff there was very accommodating. Had some very pleasant conversation with several staff members and they never made me feel rushed. The room was decent size (very small closet) with a very comfortable king bed. The views of Universal City and the San Fernando valley were outstanding. Again, very impressive and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend in December. Service was impeccable. We loved the lobby bar and they have an excellent martini list and they even have absinthe. The restaurant was excellent for foot and service, breakfast buffet was very nice. All areas of the hotel we experienced excellent service. Our room was cozy and the bed comfy. We had a view of Studio Citu from the 18th floor. Unfortunately out room got hot from setting sun and the ac was not enough to cool it down. Our ac was also very loud and after maintenance it was still loud. We will be staying here again in February since we loved it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Yups89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night (dec 28 - 30) stay with my wife and kid. Staff were courteous, the size of the room is ok but the t&b is a bit small. One major complaint however is their aircon. Especially during the wee hours of the morning, both nights my wife and I woke up because the aircon is simply not enough to cool the room. Maybe that is the reason why they have a small fan inside the closet. I have read a complaint from another site with the same problem. The thing we like most about the hotel is the great location. Easy walk to Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about at all”
Reviews.Author: sambas2
Reviews.Content: great view - on the valley side very convenient location - 7 minute walk to universal studios/citywalk...or can wait for a free shuttle every 15 minutes. Close to Burbank airport, and hollywood. 2 minor complaints: prices of food and parking were a bit steep. For example, Self-park was $18/night, my bottle of soda in the gift shop was $3 + tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and gym!!”
Reviews.Author: DWfromNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at a VERY busy time of the year. The first room that we were given had a minor problem which I reported to the front desk with a request for another room. We were given a lovely upgraded room for our trouble and in addition we received breakfast vouchers. I was very impressed with how the front desk staff handled the issue. I also received an email the following day asking if everything was OK and if there was anything they could do to improve our visit. The front desk staff on Thursday DEc 29th was excellent. In addition ALL of the staff were extremely courteous and friendly througout our stay. We wanted to stay an additional day but the hotel was sold out. The gym was clean, there was a variety of equipment, and we did not have to wait to use any of the equipment. The location is great expecially if you plan to visit Citywalk or Universal. We were visiting a relative in Hollywood which is right over the hill...about 10 minutes by car. We will definitely stay here again next year but I will book earlier so I can get the extra night. Also concierge was very helpful on Friday Morning.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY HOTEL ! QUALITY PEOPLE ! GREAT LOCATION !”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT B
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the Sheraton Universal for a relaxing and enjoyable stay. A special thank you to Max and Laurie at the Front Desk, and Rick Sanchez in the California Restaurant for his detailed info on Universal Studios and his unbridled humour. Our stay was from Dec 20th to 29th, during which time we found everything very satisfactory. We elected to go â€˜Greenâ€™ and collected enough points to enjoy a fantastic breakfast for our family prior to our departure. Self parking, although $18 for the first day, was only $9 per day afterwards. We found the rooms Clean, and Comfortable, and enjoyed a fantastic sleep every night. No problems with the Heat or A/C, and extra blankets were available if necessary. Staying on the 15th (Club) floor, we often and easily scooted down to the 9th for the Continental Breakfast, and late afternoon â€˜Horses Durvsâ€™. If we wanted some AM/PM privacy, we simply took food back to our room. The Hotel was clean, quiet, friendly, and all the employees seemed to really â€˜Careâ€™ ! -- something that you do not see often these days. The hotel is perfectly located, approximately 2 blocks from Universal City, which can easily be reached by Shuttle directly at the front door, walking down to the Metro/Universal Shuttle, taking the elevator up to the Hilton Hotel level and walking over, or, as we did, you can easily walk up the hill. We chose the Walk to get some exercise, and work off the extra pounds that one gains on vacation. The Hotel is also located close to Warner Bros Studios, The Hollywood Bowl, Mulhulland Drive, The â€˜Hollywoodâ€™ sign, and Forest Lawn Cemetery ( Where a lot of the Movie Stars are interred. Only a short drive, or take the Metro to the Walk of Stars, Graumanâ€™s Chinese Theatre, the Kodak Theatre, Paramount Studios, and other local attractions. We travelled on Hollywood Blvd, Santa Monica Blvd, Rodeo Drive, and shopped at Westfields in Century City, right beside Fox Studios, and were lucky enough to shop directly beside Movie Star, Amie Adams, in Bloomingales. The Santa Monica Pier is beautiful at night with all the lights. If you stay at The Sheraton Universal, either drive or walk over to Ventura Blvd, and try the â€˜ IN-N-OUT BURGERâ€™. The burgers are fantastic and inexpensive. Many involved in the movie business frequent this quality fast food location. Also try the â€˜Panda Expressâ€™â€”Great Chinese & Thai food. We would not hesitate to stay at the Sheraton Universal Hotel upon our next visit to the area, and would highly recommend this QUALITY Hotel to all our fellow Canadians, or anybody visiting Universal City, and the surrounding tourist attractions. Thank you to the Management, and ALL the employees for very positive and memorable experience

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel for visiting studios”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: The strongest point of the hotel is the fantastic location. It is a very comfortable 10 minute walk from the studios. Yes this isn't the cheapest hotel but the standard is excellent and the location is really worth paying a premium for. The room was first rate with a great view over the studios. We actually got a really good deal booking online but I notice that for other dates it was much more expensive. Highly recommended for families visiting universal studios. Very convenient for subway and the drive into Hollywood was much quicker than I had expected to be so can also be used as a base for visiting LA more generally. All in all a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Glendale”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while on business in Glendale. Bed was very comfortable, I had a great view from the 17th floor. Room was very bright, lots of natural light - which I loved. Front desk staff were friendly, housekeeping does a great job. Room was very clean and smelled great. Towels were bright white. Overall a very nice stay. Gift shop in the lobby is also open late and has snacks, toiletries and souveniers. They also gave me internet for free since it was my first time staying here - very nice! I will certainly return on my next trip to the area. I also discovered on my last night that there is a small shopping center around the corner (Riteaid/CVS, gourmet grocery, Starbucks and some small shops.) Very convenient place for breakfast/coffee and take out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but greatly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: James L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in December, Great staff during check-in and during my stay. However the prices are out of control. Visiting Universal Studios there are really only two hotels to choose from for walking distance, this one and the Hilton, the Hilton is cheaper. Here at the Sheraton it is $18/night to self-park and $24 + tip for valet. I had requested a mini-fridge for my room which was never delivered. When getting hungry I thought about room service but saw that it would cost about $29 for a bowl of oatmeal and a glass of milk. No thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Visiting Universal Studios or Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: SURF4FUN007
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is a great property located a top a hill in the Universal Studio's complex. You can get a view of the Hollywood Hills/ pool or Universal Studio/Valley view. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, however, they did show some minor signs of wear and tear. Room service was prompt and tasty although they no longer have their unique menu, now it's just standard Sheraton fare. There is shuttle service from the hotel that takes you right to the front gate of Universal Studios. The hotel is also located a short distance to the Red Line Metro Stop which will take you to Union Station, link you to Pasadena Gold Line or the LAX and Long Beach Lines. As others have mentioned, if you decide to walk anywhere, there is a steep hill that you'll need to endure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: albertc9
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Los Angeles and stayed here for a week. From the moment we stepped onto the property we were treated exceptionally well by every staff member we encountered. A big thanks, in particular, to Sam who checked us in and gave us much more than we expected! We chose one of the Lanai rooms overlooking the pool area but looking back, I would've chosen a Tower room since it was rather cold on many days and couldn't take advantage of the balcony. The room itself was cozy and clean but we noticed the fire detector was missing with just a jumble of wires hanging out of the wall. It was quiet most nights so we had a restful sleep except for one night where one of neighbors were getting a bit, uhhhh, intimate rather loudly. The location can't be beat for what we were looking to do. The shuttle is extremely convenient and handy to get to Universal Studios and CityWalk since it can get a little tiring walking up the steep hill. Other areas of the city were easily accessible with the Metro Rail and a transit centre at the bottom of the hill. And the Club Lounge provided a fantastic continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvre with a great view of the area from the 9th floor. The staff did a great job ensuring there was plenty of food and drink available and the tables cleared promptly. Overall this is a fantastic hotel with friendly staff and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: swills9
Reviews.Content: Had our 3rd or 4th stay at the Sheraton in November this year (2011), we were in two minds about styaing here after our last stay which was both noisy and during a 'convention' noisy and on our landing a smell of alcohol! ( 2 nights) This time however the roonm was quite with a nice view from the (it has to be said) rather dirty window, looks like it had not been cleaned for some few months, not that easy I suppose 11 floors up. Again at the end of the week, there was some sort of convention, and we were kept up until 0245 in the morning with laughing and doors slamming shut, this was mentioned to the desk who did apologise. The other thing that annoyed me, and one of the reasons we went back to this Hotel, after the last trip, we had a letter saying that we would be given a free entry to UNIVERSAL, this latter was emailed back to them a couple of weeks before went, but the desk knew nothing, and the offer was never given to us. Parking was about $20 per night, but even as guests you do not get priority/resevered areas, thus on a few nights when events were on, we ended up on the very top deck squeezing in, and on one moring, some nice person had bent out licence plate through 90 degrees... why ? ! Would i stay again, possibly, it is handy for City Walk and the Freeway (101) Rooms are clean, Staff are very freindly, it's the little things that can really spoil the vacation,

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: DrStuo
Reviews.Content: First the good: it is a great location and a beautiful hotel and we got a good price thru an internet site. Checkin desk service was top notch and we got a nice room on the 18th floor with a million dollar view of the San Fernando Valley. But: the bathroom was very compact, the bed felt very comfortable when I first lay down but I woke with a severe back ache. The room was too hot all night long despite the fact the air conditioner was working. In the morning my wife noticed that there was a portible fan in the closet which leads me to believe other tourists had complained about it being too hot and our discovery was too late to help us. Neither of us got a good night's sleep. Note that self parking costs $18 a day and there is No street parking available. You do have in and out priveleges with the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff, great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: randrl
Reviews.Content: The manager at this hotel obviously understands what customer service is all about. Throughout our four day stay we did not find one employee who wasn't incredibly pleasant as well as helpful and so eager to make sure you have what you need and that you enjoy your stay They were so friendly without being too familiar. From the minute you step out the door of your transport to the minute you check-out, the well trained staff is there to make sure you will not hesitate coming back if your travel brings you back to this area. It is so unusual to find a place where every single employee without exception is great. It is the norm here..The property is very nice , the rooms are clean and spacious and the location is right next to Universal & City Walk with a free shuttle that runs all the time.The red line subway to other areas of LA is a short walk which is an added plus. They boast a beautiful lobby with a bar area , and a very well stocked sundry shop. I will try to find a reaso to get back to LA so I can stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Icats
Reviews.Content: We visited LA from Oct. 27 to Oct. 30th for Halloween Haunt Night, a USC game and to visit friends. From the moment we checked in at 11:30 at night, the superb staff made us feel welcome, the bar was actually open, and the room was amazing. We got a corner room with a 2 walls of windows (thanks to being Starwood Owners I'm sure!). Great bed, while the bathroom is small, it's fully functionable, and we had a great view of LA. Valet service rocks, as they run to your car and are so nice and helpful. Location was perfect! We took an hour walk to Warner Brothers for a VIP tour (very fun experience) on a beautiful October day, enjoyed a great choice of restaurants on the walk there (recommend Paty's at Toluca Lakes) and walked through lovely residential areas. Took the free shuttle up the hill to CityWalk, did Universal's Halloween Haunt Night (get the Front of the Line pass), and walked back to hotel late at night. Did a USC game, while only 15 miles away, it did take an hour to get there, so have patience! On last day of trip, took a 20 minute drive (through West Hollywood) and went to eat brunch at the Marmalade Cafe at the Grove (outdoor shopping center and farmer's market) where they film Extra everyday. They were preparing for Halloween and Christmas in the same day. Very fun. Overall, great experience. We will return in a heartbeat next year. Great customer service, great room, and with so many fun activities/places to see surrounding the hotel, it's a win-win for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting NBC Universal”
Reviews.Author: 81FrequentT81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before meetings at NBC Universal. Hotel is just outside Universal. Hotel is a little on the older side, though still quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Universally superb!”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: Steps from Universal Citywalk and the similarly named adjacent theme park, the Sheraton Universal is arguably the most convenient hotel in the San Fernando Valley. Â A subway station for the Metro Red Line which is a 10-minute walk down the hill to Cahuenga, grants quick access the Hollywood attractions and downtown sports venues. Â If you care to park on the freeway with 10,000 of your closest friends, the 101, the 134 and the 170 are close by. Universal Citywalk has some great family-friendly restaurants like Wolfgang Puck, Tony Roma's and the Hard Rock Cafe. Â And, you can catch Jay Leno filming the "J-Walking" segment of the Tonight Show Â right around dinnertime here. Â Â  Â From the exquisitely polished brass handrails on the exterior walkway to the Zen-inspired front lobby, the hotel welcomes the weary traveler with a aura of sophistication and serenity. Â I have only been to a handful of other Sheraton properties but this is the nicest by far. Â  The people who work here rock! Â Every staff member we encountered was completely capable and Sam, one of the managers, truly went above and beyond with regard to getting us an extra room for a co-worker at the last minute so we could all be at the same property. I had a very nice room with a view of the Cahuenga Pass. The room was cleaned well with the somewhat troubling exception of pubes in the bathtub. Â The Club Lounge was stocked with an ample supply of snacks and beverages and the host and hostess ensured the food items were well presented. Â  Sadly, this is my last stay as a Platinum member before losing status with Starwood next year. Â "Thank you" Sheraton Universal made it great!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient is about all”
Reviews.Author: andysmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in order to visit Universal Studios. Checked in around 7 p.m. We were given a room on the floor just above the lobby where the walls are paper thin. While watching a movie with our 10 year old, our next door neighbors began engaging in a very loud "party" if you know what I mean. My husband and I were horrified and our son wanted to know what was going on. We could hear every disgusting word and utterance. It was beyond disturbing and in all my years of travel all over the world, I have never encountered this. I raced to the front desk and we were quickly moved to the 7th floor. The room was slightly better but we could still hear every movement from next door and above. Besides this, the hotel is dated and worn. The next night there was a wedding in the lobby (of all places) and the whole hotel was loud and busy. Kids were running back and forth on our floor until the wee hours of the night. Yes, it's a 5 minute walk to the Studios but I think we'll try another hotel should we ever visit here again. By the way, Universal Studios was interesting and fun but I have to say, the innuendos were everywhere including on many of the "rides". Oh well, this is Hollywood afterall...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well located hotel with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MBA31
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7th to 11th November 2011. Excellently located hotel within short walking distance of Universal studios and Universal city. Rooms newly refurbished to a very good standard. The staff are superb, all very helpful and the concierge staff in particular are extremely helpful and knowledgable, providing maps and advice to ensure you make the most of your stay. Highly recommended hotel , would definitely stay there again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the location but it did have some downs.”
Reviews.Author: vamartinez05
Reviews.Content: We traveled to universal studios and decided since we have a baby it would be great to walk to a close hotel and we chose the Sherwton Universal. The location is excellent and only about a 5 minute walk to Universal Studios. We had 6 adults staying with us and my baby and we were put into an executive suite which I was told it had one bedroom and a queen size bed in the living room area and a couch that would fold out, and about 600 sq ft of space with balcony When I heard this it was perfect especially for the price I was quoted. I walked n and was very pleased with the room only to find out though that there was no bedroom for me and my husbands privacy and the couch did not fold out. I thought where would we put all these people?! Went downstairs thinking they gave me the wrong room but no they said that's only the presidential suite. So I thought why would I make up what the room is the lady told me over the phone. Of course I was upset the only thing they did was offer me one cot free of charge which I accepted but the other adult slept on the couch. Over all the hotel is nice inside and clean, staff is nice. But with then knowing I had 6 adults they should have told me to either get two rooms or upgrade. I asked how much for the presidential suite they never provided me a price and I didn't get the other cot until 4 hours later I had to go back downstairs and ask for it. I would stay here again but make sure the room u get is the correct one just verify it with the rep. My overall experience here was good despite all the adults in a smaller room. We stayed on the 11th floor in room 1109. :) have a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Loll73
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in the middle of October , rooms a good size (no mininbar) and bathroom very small and dated .Combined shower/bath and old fixtures.The hotel in general just feels tired and old (even though its supposedly been renovated) .The hotel serves a purpose and that is its close proximity to Universal Studios.You can walk there in ten minutes and get to the city walk where you are spoilt for choice on food/drink options . Also the concierge gets very busy and you can wait a while to be seen - also didn't find the concierge very helpful . Would I stay here again ? only if I wasn't paying

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshirePeppie
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Sure wish they'd have a shuttle though to airport but the Super Shuttle is fine. Chizuru at concierge was beyond belief. She was delightful and so accommodating. Went above and beyond and made our stay phenomenal. All the concierge staff was superb and loved the walk to Universal. It was so much fun and the subway so close to everything as well. I suggest the TMZ tour at Hollywood and Highland. The mexican restaurant at Citywalk is great too. The park is very nice off season. No lines (was sorry I bought the front of the line pass). You will love it here. Lovely business center, food was super and the staff par none. Every person who helped us was simply delightful and seemed to truly care about our stay. Franchesca and Alex and the chef (sorry to blank on his name) and Chichi the hostess were all terrific. I would come here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Really good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mrlasvegass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September 2011 for a week after leaving the Andaz hotel in West Hollywood due to very poor customer service. Our Tour Operator Virgin booked us in to this hotel and I was initially unconvinced with their choice. However I was very wrong, on our arrival in the late evening by taxicab we were met by two reception managerâ€™s one male and female in what appeared to be very clean and modern hotel. They were very supportive of our previous problems at the Andaz, we paid for the buffet breakfast, we were put on the Sheraton 'Club Level' floor and given vouchers for free drinks on the club level floor as complimentary. The room was very clean and modern with two double beds, free internet, I pod docking station and complimentary starbucks coffee. We also had great views of the city, however there is no mini bar or fridge in the rooms. At the rear of the lobby there are several computers that give you free internet, there is a small store selling basics a very modern bar and a good size 24hour fitness centre on the basement level, which was always empty when we used it, and above all the staff were very friendly and approachable. The Restaurant serving breakfast, and dinner was very clean; we used the breakfast buffet for our six night stay. The choice was really good and varied which included scrambled, boiled and egg omelettes, bacon, sausage, hash browns, hot and cold cereals with bread and muffins, fruits, yogurts and a choice of pastries. Now the fun stuff!! Universal Studios and City Walk is literally on the door step, there is a free shuttle from the hotel that takes you to Universal studios, but you can walk it around five minutes. Universal City Station is a seven minute walk from the Hotel, which is on the red line that takes you directly to Hollywood/Highland (Hollywood Boulevard/Walk of Fame area) one stop in less than ten minutes. It costs $1.50 each way but a day pass was $5 which you can use on the buses and trains. We felt safe on the train when we travelled and that was at all times of the day. The last train being around 1.00am. As I said previously we stayed at this hotel for six nights, the staff were very pleasant, rooms clean and we used the public transport system to get around LA, this included getting public transport to see the dodgers play the Arizona diamondbacks. We would certainly go back to this hotel again if we go back to LA again especially when all you want is a comfy clean bed and room after an eleven hour flight from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: TexasTripper_7
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for the location and comfort and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and the accomodating hotel staff. We called the front desk on several occasions during our four night stay and our concerns were addressed immediately (extra towels, room refrigerator, noisy neighbors). Loved the Starbucks coffee in the rooms. Two drawbacks - the walls are so thin you can hear the guests next to you talking so when they started yelling at 2am, we woke up and called security. This happened 2 nights in a row. Also, clean your windows Sheraton!!! We pulled back the drapes to look at the amazing views and could hardly see it due to dirty windows that looked like muddy water had been thrown on them. Otherwise, got a good rate when bundled with a car rental so definately worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here ALL THE TIME- Great Location IN LA”
Reviews.Author: Sparky8188
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Universal is in a great location to get to lots of different things easily in LA. We stay here all the time and we are treated like family by all the staff. The hotel does get very busy on the weekends with events and guests so beware of longer elevator waits but other than that the hotel has everything you need. The rooms are very quiet. The club level lounge is amazing! The pool and gym are nice. You are within walking distance to all the City Walk restaurants and to Universal Studios which is very nice! You are minutes away from Ventura Avenue and all the shops and restaurants that it offers. I suggest flying into Burbank and staying at this hotel! You won't be disappointed and it's hassle free!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackrory
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back home to the UK after a week staying at the hotel with my family. We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and were in our room in no time, which after a 12 hour flight was great. This hotel is in a great location for universal studios - which is fantastic! It's a five minute walk but the hotel provide a shuttle service there and back if you feel lazy. We decided not to rent a car in LA and instead to try and get around using cabs and public transport, The Concierge told us how to do this, and pointed us to the metro station a short walk from the hotel. A day ticket for the metro and busses is only $5.00 a day, Its pretty easy to get around and we felt safe at all times. Rooms are a decent size and the beds are big & very comfortable, Shower is great!! only real issues we had with the room was with with the toilet, it was always reluctant to flush for some reason. Also could do with some free TV stations for children to keep them entertained while parents are getting ready to go out. Do not hesitate in booking this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This place is everything you could ask for in a top notch hotel.”
Reviews.Author: reddoor14
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay while visiting universal studios. It felt secluded although close to the theme park and gave us a chance to get away from the crowds to a high class place. I would stay there again! The staff made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Sjc462
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived we received a warm welcome from the valet parking which was a great start to our LA stay. The room, on the SPG level was great, with good views, however, it would have been nice to have had a fridge of some sort. This hotel felt safe and was perfectly located for Universal Studios and the City Walk. There is a complimentary shuttle to the Studios but it is a 5 minute walk, if that. Prior to coming to this hotel I had phoned, from the UK to get a treat arranged but was bitterly disappointed when we got to the room that this had not been arranged, and was even more dismayed that when I went to the gym and spoke to a young lady on reception she appeared disinterested, however on speaking to another receptionist, Cherry I think my faith was restored with a complimentary gift to the room. The SPG lounge is clean & pleasant and you can keep yourself stocked up with bottles of cold water from the fridge. If the sky lounge is not being used for a function I can highly recommend going up there, especially at night where you will get some stunning views. I will certainly chose this hotel if I go to LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: lppenny23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a mini trip to the park. I think it's def overpriced for the quality of the hotel. The people there were great and the drinks at the hotel bar were very cheap at happy hour! The hotel is very close to the park so that's nice. The bed was not so comfy and the room needed a little updating. We called at night for a robe and slippers and they brought it right up. Good hotel.. Yet overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Canuck60
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean and close to Universal Studios... Self parking (even though you have to pay ...cheaper than valet ) was very easy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Universal Studios

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to visit Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: BKBLUELOGIC
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to visit Universal Studios then this hotel is just right for you. It is walking distance from Universal Studios - LA and City walk. There is a free shuttle service through out the day if you don't want to walk. Standard rooms are very basic, but the bed was comfortable. If you want to spend much time in your hotel room , I advice you to go for an upgrade, as the rooms are small in size. We were one couple so the size of the room was acceptable and we didn't spend anytime in the room except when we wanted to shower or sleep. There is no minibar or fridge for standard room so if you are planning to buy stuff that needs a fridge think twice. We bought chips and biscuits for snacks. The parking is 18 US$ per day but you can go in and out as much as you like. So include that in your budget if you are renting a car. I would advice you to rent a car in LA as the taxis are bit pricey. Hotel lobby is very nice and clean, staff are friendly. The 45 minutes free internet at the lobby for guests are very useful and you can use printers to print boarding passes or tickets for free. We used to check tripadvisor for local attractions nearby and plan our day. There is internet in the room with a fee. Breakfast was around 22 US$ open buffet but limited, however you don't need more than scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries , french toast, fruit salad, hash browns to start your day. I suggest you walk to city walk mall for breakfast if you are an early riser since shuttles start at around 9 am. In conclusion, if you are planning a trip to LA and your main goal is to visit Universal studios and spend most of your time there I highly recommend the hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel for "name your own price"”
Reviews.Author: truxr4girlz
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this hotel for $89 a night on priceline, but I would never pay more then that. Our room was VERY small, one of the tiniest bathrooms ever and I travel often. Self Parking is $18 a night which is average for this area. The concierge was super hard to understand with her hard accent and wouldnt stop pushing us to get a town car instead of a cab (pretty annoying, she waisted 20 minutes of our time by refusing to get the cab and pushing the town car!!) We ordered room service which was 15 minutes late, and we were in a hurry that morning (the whole reason we ordered room service) . Very overpriced.. Which I know room service is pricey, but when ordering a bagel I expected better quality, maybe costco sized bagel for $6. Not a tiny stail thomas bagel.. not even garnish on the plate, kind of shocking. And a side of hashbrowns for $6 that was smaller then the palm of my hand.. Also, it says on their website rooms have refridgerators, They do NOT! we didnt use the pool or hot tub, but the main reason we didnt is because the hot tub looked somewhat green from our room view. We also had a view of Vivid Entertainment studios (porn production company) LOL.. I must mention the positive points of our stay also! It was the PERFECT location for the reason we came to the area. If you are going to attend tapings to any tv shows its very close to all of the studios, LOVE that! I wish I knew the name of the guy sho checked us in . He was SO friendly and made us feel very welcomed and genuinly seemed to care about our stay. If concierge gets paid more he should be promoted! Also loved the walking distance to universal city. Although we didnt go to the theme park, the city walk is fantastic and I highly reccomend it. Very affordable restaurants there, and many of them! We plan to come to the area several times a year because we loved the experience of TV show tapings and still have so many things we want to do. Would only stay at the Sheraton again if there is an AMAZING deal, but will never order room service again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Past_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay at this hotel. Upon arriving, I was very impressed with the lobby. It was very modern and reminded me of a W hotel. The front desk men were very nice, helpful and efficient. I was upgraded to a corner room, which I assume had a little bit more space. The beds were the normal Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds and very comfortable. There was a small flat screen tv in the room. The bathroom was smaller than some, but bigger than other hotels I've stayed in. It wasn't terrible by any means. The only "awkward" part was that the toilet was really close to the bathroom door. You couldn't open the door if someone was sitting down. I could hear the sounds of other guests through the walls at times, but I think that is somewhat normal when you're in a hotel. Overall, the room was clean and perfectly fine for my trip. I would stay here again. I was by myself this trip, but even if I were travelling with others, there was plenty of room in the room itself and several mirrors throughout the room so that you could continue getting ready while someone else is in the bathroom. The only odd thing was that when I woke up in the middle of the night, I didn't see an alarm clock, which is very odd for any hotel room. Upon waking up in the morning and looking around, there was an alarm clock, it just wasn't plugged in and I hadn't realized that the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naomir81
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we where a little bit concerned about staying here but now we are not sure if they stayed at the same hotel as us. The service we recived was fantastic we arrived before the 3pm check in time and Emeka was able to check us in straight away. We found the location fantastic it is a 5min walk to universal studios and city walk a 5min walk to universal city station and then its only 1 stop on the train to the chinese theatre and a 10min bus ride to warner bros studios. Daisaku was able to help us with bus times to and from warner bros. All the staff where very friendly and helpful whenever we had a question and also received a hello whenever we walked into the hotel. The room was clean and comfy the bathroom was nice and clean, we had no problems with the lift waited 5mins at the most for a lift to arrive and we used the lifts at all different times of the day even with 2 functions on in the hotel there was still no problems with the wait time. We would like to thank Emeka (his Favourite ellen guests) and Daisaku for all there help over the time we stayed there nothing was to big for them to help us with

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hollie_s8
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 2 sisters, one of which was with her husband and young family. The hotel provided everything we needed for our short stay there, a pool for the kids, a short walk to the Universal City Walk and nightlife for us - Hotel had comfortable rooms, perfect location, and an amazing breakfast. Staff were very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you are visiting Universal Studios it is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was our first time to Sheraton in years since we stopped staying at Sheraton some years ago since we thought they were all old and needed refurbishment. Now this hotel has been renovatet and we found out many of the Sheratons are going through renovation. The room was very nice and spacious and since I love Starbucks coffee I was happy to see the room was equipped with a coffee maker and Starbucks coffee :-) There is a nice pool area, not big but not overcrowded so after the gym and a shower it was great relaxing there. Location is good eventhough you do not want to go to Universal Studios etc. (which we did not) The staff was very friendly in all areas and we did not experience any problems at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MAK101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for five days during a conference. We received an excellent event rate. The room wasn't huge but it was nicely appointed with dark wood furniture, flat screen TV, and a pull-out couch. It didn't appear old or in need of updating. I obtained a "Lanai Room" which overlooked the pool with a balcony -- I was told by other conference attendees that their regular rooms weren't as nice as ours. Maid service was thorough and efficient. The restaurant, bar, and gift shop were nice but over-priced. There are your typical conference rooms as well as a small bank of computers. There's a small bar by the pool. The customer service at this hotel was truly first-class; I didn't encounter anyone who wasn't exceptionally friendly, helpful and highly professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you want to visit Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Winnie999
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location for those wanting to visit Universal Studios. If you are travelling from Los Angeles airport you can expect to pay $90.00 for a taxi. If you take the shuttle bus it is only $20.00. It is worthwhile purchasing your tickets to Universal Studios through the hotel as they offer a pay for one day and get the second day free. So it only costs $77.00 for two days admission. The hotel itself has nice feel and I would rate it a 4 star hotel. The hotel bed is really comfortable as Sheraton beds always are. The a â€™la carte breakfast was good. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, showing some wear”
Reviews.Author: APDJOHN
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this property. The lobby was nice, the staff were great and so friendly. The bathroom would be my only complaint as it was showing wear and needed to be fixed. The paint was peeling and just generally worn out. Other than that, you cannot beat the location if you are going to Universal. Again, the staff made the trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location...”
Reviews.Author: ielkin
Reviews.Content: Easy access to major road 101/170, walk to subway station AND to the Studios! Comfortable room and bed, all amenities as expected. Free internet stations, huge parking garage. Great service, including concierge. "Minuses": long elevators waiting time, especially in "rush hrs"; morning "starbucks" in the lobby bar is quite far from the real brand flavor. Otherwise its all good.

Reviews.Title: “I wrote the review 2 mo ago that was titled "stay at the Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: Motnzil
Reviews.Content: 2 mo ago we had an unfortunate experience. My husband and I decided to give it another chance and boy did the Sheraton redeem themselves!! Extremely clean room, nice and quiet, everything in perfect working order, staff was professional, friendly, and extremely helpful, club lounge was clean and fresh, our overall stay was a 10 out of 10! Everyone deserves a 2nd chance and I'm glad we stayed there again, so happy with the hotel we will be coming back in October with our children to attend Universal Studios again!!! Thank you Sheraton for going above and beyond, see you next month!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for visiting Universal Studio”
Reviews.Author: xnipenn
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel for visiting Universal Studio. 5 minutes shuttle bus to Universal Studio. We stayed there 2 nigths. Staffs were very friendly, and helpfull. Room is clean. We bought our tickets for Universal Studio at hotel. you pay one tickets for 2-day entries.

Reviews.Title: “HOT in CALIFORNIA..........................”
Reviews.Author: Louise0518
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four day visit to California and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Fernando, the conceirge, who helped us with all our questions and booked our tickets for the new, Cirque del Soliel, IRIS. He even took the time to show us the quick way from the hotel to the subway in order to get to Hollywood and Vine to the Kodak Theatre where the show was being held. It was only $3.00 round trip. The room at the Sheraton was clean and the beds were VERY comfortable. And, yes, this is the hotel where ELLEN has her guests stay during her shows. A very enjoyable stay, but way too short. We will certainly keep this hotel in mind if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “brillant location for LA would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: streakySWales
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Virgin, Arrived at the Sheraton and found it be a modern look hotel. On our arrival was given a room that was not ready and as an apology without any hestiation they offered free internet access for the holiday. With a teenage daughter who wanted to keep in touch with friends on social network sites that was very usefull. We were given room 818 which had a lovely view of the hills, The breakfast was buffet but more than enough for what was needed. There didn't seem to be many breakfast diners close by which you find in other parts of the States. Location wise could walk to Universal studios without any hassle. The hotel is located on the side of the freeway with ease to travel towards the Pacific Coast but noise from the traffic which in LA is considerable is not a problem. The Hotel has well equipped gym and light and airy bar. All the staff were friendly and would recommend this hotel to others. Parking on site was $18 a day but that in that part of LA was not extortationate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: denjolu
Reviews.Content: Clean, close to attractions, nice view. The lobby was beautiful and the rooms were nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. Universal Studios and Citywalk within walking distance. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: BizDevRoadee
Reviews.Content: The good: the staff and the location. The ok: room amenitites and decor. The not so good: this is an old hotel that's been renovated. The rooms are evidence of this. The bathroom was tiny, the light switches barely worked, stuff was just a bit rundown. The restaurant was really expensive ($14 for oatmeal, juice and coffee?!) and $7 a day for Internet. But, this really is an ideal location for visiting Universal Studios and City Walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: The staff showed that they were trained properly and provided me with excellent service. I was even impressed with the valet service which normally is the downfall of most properties. It was the first time that a valet cleaned my windshield when they noticed it was dirty. Sometimes the smallest details means the most. The only negative was the long wait for the elevators in the morning and the small sink in the guest room. Other than that, my stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property in the past and all of my time there including this month, was just great. Staff was incredible from the housekeeping to the front desk to the restaurant and the bar area. Weather was great in LA and I would never ever consider staying anywhere else. Sheraton in Universal City is the place to be. I was glad to get back home but when I climbed into my bed, I couldn't help but wish I was still in the large king comfy bed at the Sheraton :) Go there and stay - you will not regret it. Margaret

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scorp1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Universal Sheraton with my partner. The room had a king size bed, small loveseat, coffee table and desk. Nice size bathroom, closet and balcony overlooking the pool. The room was clean and the hallways were quiet. The hotel has a spacious well-kept lobby and very friendly staff. And it's pet friendly. I would definitely stay here again when I get back to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Moonstone07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Universal while visiting Universal Studios. The hotel was very clean, bed linens were crisp and the bed was comfortable and inviting. We got a very reasonable rate, even better than the on-line rate by calling the reservation line. The staff at the hotel were helpful and very professional. We had a minor problem when we first arrived of a toilet that would not flush. Our room was quickly changed by the front desk staff. Self-parking at the hotel is $18.00 in a covered garage. There is a free shuttle to the Universal park. It was so convenient running about every 15 minutes. The pool area was clean, plenty of poolside towels available. Very enjoyable! If you are traveling with a family, there are some rooms around the pool area which probably be very convenient if you have children that want to spend a lot of time in the pool. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location. Website does not do it justice. Staff brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: leeclump5
