Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Wanted to be close to universal studios...couldn't be closer, could see studios and filming locations right from our bedroom window. Free shuttle takes you to and from universal all day and up until 9.30pm. After this time you can walk back, takles about ten minutes and is downhill. Staff superb. Nothing too much trouble. One of our group was poorly with ear infection, staff were great at organising taxi to a drs surgery etc. Very helpful! Breakfast was great. Most of us ordered off the menu, but buffet also good. Upgraded to front of line pass for universal studios. Well worth it, queued for 30seconds to 1 min for the rides. Whereas other queues approximately 50-70minutes long!! We organised a private tour of the sights, for family of 5 this was cheaper than using open top tour bus...which in the heat would have been awful! Would definitely stay here again if we were going back to universal.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: strawmato
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk away from the Univeral city walk. There are buses to downtown LA. Really enjoyed my stay and Universal Studies being 5 minutes away meant that I could stay n the park all day and not worry about shuttle buses. My only minor problem was that my room was difficult to find as it was at the rear of the building. Once I knew where I was going it wasn't a problem. Lots of conferences going on at hte hotel which meant the bar/restaurant was always busy. Easier to eat out on the city walk.

Reviews.Title: “I have spent over 20 nights in this hotel and it is nice.”
Reviews.Author: Exploremt
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel for business a couple times a year. It has a stylish lobby and nice views. I have no complaints about the staff they all seem pleasant. I do not reccommend eating at the resturant or drinking at their bar as their pricing is outrageous. There are plenty of good resturants within a 10 minute drive and if you are on foot, simply walk up to the carnival atmosphere of the Universal City Walk, which while somewhat overstimulating and full of tourists has some decent resturants and bars that are, if you can believe it, cheaper than at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: saraben
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here at the end of our holiday. The hotel was immaculate with all the facilities you would expect from a Sheraton. Would certainly recommend for business travellers or holiday makers. Lovely pool area with its own bar. Business Centre. Free transfers to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are going to Universal”
Reviews.Author: SimmoHanoi
Reviews.Content: This is a good five star hotel very handy to Universal Studios. Rooms are decent. They charged us an extra 50% for late check out which borders on being fair. They run a shuttle bus to Universal which stops you having to pay for parking

Reviews.Title: “Add a jungle gym to the Club Level”
Reviews.Author: paul h
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG member and this is my second time coming to this hotel. Last year tthe Sheraton had complimentary beer and wine. Not this year. I must say too many children running wild with no supervision. No wonder kids get abducted, anyways - The club level is a disaster - No where to sit, dirty little hands touching everything, limited selection and the wonderful laughter of the precious children. The morning was worse. I get free nights so I shouldn't complain, but what the heck. I will continue to use my points, but i will not splurge on the Club Level. The Sheraton must be really discounting these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: coastskigirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as we were planning on visiting Universal Studios. Was so close we were able to walk or catch the shuttle bus that left at regular intervals. The young guy we got for our check in was really friendly and helpful and as our flight was leaving late happily gave us a late check out. Probably the only annoying thing is no free wi-fi in rooms and the cost of car parking but overall we where happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range hotel with good location for attractions”
Reviews.Author: LakesiderToronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very good if the purpose of your stay involves spending time at Universal Studios. It's a very short walk and there is a complimentary shuttle so if you've spent all day at the Studios, you'll be glad to have your room close by. There is only one restaurant which is on par for this type of hotel. The lobby bar lacks character and is situated in the middle of the main foyer and there is only one shop which offers the standard gift and traveller's supplies. Request a room in the lower podium area surrounding the courtyard pool. The rooms are generously sized with large balconies that overlook the pool, providing a retro southern California vibe. The rooms and common areas were clean and overall the staff service levels were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Tina K
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Sheraton Universal Hotel. We loved every second of it. The entire staff was excellent and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The maid said hello to us every morning and made small conversations. The concierge was great. He worked efficiently, but also provided each guest with the attention that they deserved. The people at the front desk were super friendly and helpful upon our arrival. The waiter during happy hour kept our snacks full and our drinks replenished. Our room was very comfortable and had everything that I would expect in a hotel room. Yeah, the bathroom was a little small, but I'd rather have space in the room than have the bathroom take up space. The view was also wonderful. We were on the 16th floor, so we got a nice view of the pool and of the surrounding scenery. I'm not sure what they do, but when you enter the lobby, it smells amazing. I loved breathing in when I walked in each time, as weird as that may sound. The location of the hotel was the best part. It is so close to Universal Studios and they offer a discount of 2 days for the price of 1. We took advantage of buying the tickets from the concierge, but didn't end up going the second day because we saw everything at the park (except for the Shrek 4D--we weren't interested in that) in just 8 hours. I suppose we could have gone back and done some things twice, but 8 hours was enough when you're in the sun and crowds, and we had other things we wanted to do while on vacation. We didn't take the free shuttle from the hotel because we were so close that we just walked. (Avoid doing this if you do not do well with hills.) This brought us to many entertainment options from movie theaters, a bowling alley, restaurants, shops, bars, etc. Anyone can find something to do and something they will like to eat at the City Walk area. We were also a super close drive to NBC Studios and Warner Bros. Studios. We went and saw the Tonight Show with Jay Leno and took a Warner Bros Studio Tour while we were there. Both were great experiences and extremely close to the hotel. The only complaint that we had was that the elevators were very slow. They were often over crowded because people didn't want to wait anymore. I think it was pretty normal to wait at least 5 minutes for an elevator. Being on the 16th floor, I wasn't about to take the stairs. The ride up was very uncomfortable when people overstuffed themselves into the small space. In the hotel's defense, there was some pageant going on during our stay as well as the Teen Choice Awards, so perhaps they were busier than normal and their elevators don't normally experience these types of delays? The parking also was a bit pricey. I mean come on, $18 a day for a piece of concrete? That was a little bit annoying, but I guess that's life. All in all, we had a great time at the Sheraton and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “"Best Hotel of the Road trip"”
Reviews.Author: lumeljay1
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived we had nothing but wonderful feelings about this hotel. Though we self parked the valet attendants were friendly and eager to help. Front desk staff were great and our room on the 8th floor gave us a great view of the pool area. Though we didn't use the restaurant we did use Starbucks for breakfast which was just fine with us. There was a pool party on when we arrived so we headed down for music and food reasonably priced. The shuttle service was excellent to Universal and Citywalk provided lots of restaurant choices. The rooms were the cleanest I have ever seen and the decor modern and attractive. Best stay in a two week roadtrip. Loved the shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People Really Make a Difference”
Reviews.Author: RaceGirl_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we went to Universal Studios for the day. From the moment we drove on to the property the staff was welcoming and friendly. We had a great stay here because the staff made it memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very odd room .”
Reviews.Author: Marilynbn
Reviews.Content: I am writing this while we are still here at the Universal Sheraton. I will list the oddities of our poolside double queen room. No clock Slider to patio/pool area broken lock so we cannot open glass door Toilet is almost under the sink Shower head is too low at 5 feet Full length mirror is in closet behind hanging clothes. Bathroom door does not close Toilet handle needs fiddling Broken lamp switch...unusable light Plus I am amazed that any hotel is still charging for Internet access in your room. Especially for a non-high end hotel like the Sheraton. They charge $9.95 per day! As a travel agent I am usually given nice rooms so I can encourage my clients to go to the hotels that I stay at. This will not be the case for this hotel. The people have been nice but...let's see how long it takes for them to repair our slider.... So far it has been 2+ hours and no fixing.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: brooksterann
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights @ the Sheraton Universal. We got a great rate through a "name your own price" website (midweek stay probably helped) and we were not disappointed. The front desk employee was polite and he gave us our bedding choice "even though we booked through a third party"... The room was a bit small but very quiet, the beds were comfortable, linens and pillows were nice, and room & bathroom were very clean. No fridge, but our cooler sufficed. Free shuttle to Universal runs every 20 min (or less) and drops you off at the center of City Walk (very close to park entrance). We did not eat at the hotel, but we did use the fitness center and although small, the equipment & facilities were clean and very nice. Our room was on the 8th floor of the tower and had a pretty pool & hillside view. My only issues were that they charge extra for everything (parking, internet etc) and that they did not make up our room the first day, but they brought us extra towels and coffee very quickly when we requested them. Overall it was a great stay and very convenient for visiting Universal and the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed - expected more from Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Michal32
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights there. I rated this hotel with just 3/5 stars as I think you have a right to expect more from this chain. The most annoying was problems with internet â€“ any browser couldnâ€™t open the login site, neither from laptop nor smartphone. I finally called quest service, they transfer me to external tech-support company and I spent like 20 minutes with very nice guy who helped me login into internet.. But it shouldnâ€™t be like that. Then breakfast â€“ you pay like 20USD for buffet but the choice was very limited. So for me â€“ another â€œ-â€�. Location â€“ if you are going to visit Universal City or Hollywood â€“ very good choice (one stop by metro from Hollywood blvd. â€“ Kodak Theatre). If Santa Monica or downtown â€“ take another one. Be aware â€“ 100% no smoking hotel. There was also strike of some employees during my stay - just in front of the hotel â€“ bit loud â€¦ but ok, it happens - appreciated that the hotel manager addressed quests with letter explaining situation and apologies. So generally â€“ hotel ok, but from Sheraton you expect moreâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a star among local hotels but not anymore”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Universal Sheraton for the past 12 years. I have experienced a wide range of service and issues during all 4 ownership changes and management at the hotel. Prior to the renovation was probably the best time period for this hotel. Management was great at that time. Presently over the past 12 month period I have stayed at the hotel about 6-8 different times. Current management is not what I would consider to be responsive or care about their customers. They offer comment cards but NEVER respond to issues. This is not a hotel for business travelers as the hotel does not cater to them. If you are on vacation then you are the perfect victim to the hotel as there is no timliness in their vocabulary. I met with the operations manager On one of my past trips and he assured me everything would be corrected. That was a lie. The hotel has no quality control - some examples arriving in the room and TV doesn't work or no shower curtain in bathroom or telephone never charged and not operating or light bulbs burned out and non operating. This is hotel management 101 and this hotel doesn't care. Other negatives include untimely delivery of room service breakfast when ordered the night before, not reading breakfast card to not include certain items because they cause extreme allergy and could cause medical emergency, high speed wireless is a joke, some rooms have air conditioning while others don't, gift shop hours vary depending on when they decide they want to close despite hours posted in hotel guide. Forget about enjoying the view frOm your room as it would appear windows have never been washed on the outside - only when it rains. The value charged for nightly accommodations increases during summer months when there are more tourists. The prices do not meet the value at this hotel. It is sad that a hotel within the SPG family lacks proper management, upkeep of technology, quality control and time management so that all guests are treated fairly and their needs are met. I guess long time loyalty to a hotel doesn't matter anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Improving...”
Reviews.Author: Red_Dolphin-Media
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times during trips to LA, and I have to say I was very pleasantly surprilsed with the recent renovations to the lobby and bar. Also, I was worried after reading about elevator issues, but had no problems whatsoever with the elevators. I arrived at about 1am and had to wait at the desk a few minutes as there was nobody to be found..when the clerk finally emerged from the back she was a bit unfriendly (as if I had woken her or stopped her from doing something). I am an SPG gold member and she said she put me on the "club floor" on 15...yet my key never worked in the club in the morning (the club is on 9). Go figure...not sure how you have a club floor with no club. Compared to previous stays this one was better. I do normally prefer the Hilton next door as it strikes you as much more of a deluxe hotel, but the rate at the Sheraton on the night I was staying was much more reasonable. Overall not my favorite hotel, but I commend the management for improving it and hope they continue to better train staff and respect loyal SPG guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraSusieQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with our daughter and her 4 year old triplet sons. We had adjoining rooms that were beautiful and comfortable, and everyone bent over backwards to make our stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: sacoxf
Reviews.Content: I feel pretty sure this was not worth the price of Aprox. $200. The room was on the small size. The first room we were given had a gigantic red stain on the carpet, one dirty sock and a body sized grease smudge on the window. The moved us to another room and gave us free parking for the inconvenience. But I think they could have offered more. The restaurant had a very small menu. The rooms around the pool looked nice, but in the tower where we stayed, it was small and cramped with windows that needed a good wash. I was excited to stay in this hotel as it's close to universal and it has a shuttle and looks really nice in the pictures. Everything is much smaller (the room, the pool) in person. I do happen to stay in Starwood hotels frequently. I will not return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: azmommyof2
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14yr, 6yr & I stayed here for a trip to Universal Studios. The hotel room was fine, no complaints. We needed extra towels & they were promptly delivered within minutes of calling front desk. There is a shuttle to Universal Studios but we did not use it as the park is extremely close. If you are not completely out of shape or elderly, the walk should not be a problem for u. It's probably 5 minutes away.... We'll probably not return to Universal Studios again but if we did, we would definitely stay here. Btw, I was lucky enough to get this hotel using Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very helpful staff, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler20002
Reviews.Content: All three concierges I encountered were friendly and very helpful. Parking and the front greeting staff were energetic, friendly and very welcoming. The room was clean and comfortable. The room temperature remained comfortable. The room was quiet. Nice view from the room. Three elevators were mostly fine, but were not enough when there was an event at the hotel. Over our 5 night stay, the house keeping staff repeatedly left us with not enough towels each day, despite us each day requesting more towels. (4 guest should be provided with at least four bath towels.) Dining prices in the hotel were on the high side and I would recommend using the easy access to Universal City Walk restaurants. Beware that the free shuttle's last run is 10 pm from City Walk. The walk back to the hotel is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton instead!!!”
Reviews.Author: Motnzil
Reviews.Content: 1. The lock on the sliding glass door was broken off and it was about 1/4 of an inch sharp metal. Reported it two days in a row it NEVER got fixed!! I have a picture on my camera to prove it.Â  2. The metal bar to lock sliding glass door was also broken that when My daughter went to open the door it fell on top of her head. My husband immediately called the front desk.Â  3. PillowÂ Â cover was stained and also had little spots mold. Reported and was never changed. Also have pictures of that. 4. Two days in a row I asked for a refrigerator and neither time did anybody get back to me to tell me if they did or didn't have one.Â  5. It's a "universal" hotel, it states there's a nickelodeon channel but you have to pay 2.99 per show. There are no children channels.Â  6. Saturday night we go to get in our room and they changed the the code to the lock, when we were prepaid for 3 nights. Tired and all, had to walk back to the front desk to get a new key. Just a complete inconvenience for no reason! 6. Bathroom is so incredibly small. So is the room, you can hardly walk.Â  7. The lobby smells so incredibly strong like air freshener you can smell it from outside and gave me a sinus headache.Â  8. Twice they Â forgot to leave wash cloths. And only left three full size towels. Isn't there an order of how the rooms should be prepped?Â  9. Beds are so rickety and uncomfortable. After they claim and boast about their Sheraton beds. They are terrible.Â  10. It was 10:30 at night and so incredibly loud.Â  11. Â There was hair in the shower from a previous guest. Toilet was dirty Â The whole room was just not clean at all.Â  12. After we packed up our room at 8:00pm we called for a cart and 25 minutes later we still had NOT received one so we did not want to wait anymore and had to drag all of our stuff out! The service and hotel was the most disgusting experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCowley
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our time here as it's a great location for the Universal Studios visit. Had an executive club suite which was huge and well appointed - disappointed with the club offerings at cocktail time as alcoholic drinks weren't gratis . We headed downstairs to the excellent bar where we met a Hollywood screenwriter and chatted for about 3 hrs -what a blast.Staff all very professional and another quality Sheraton offering

Reviews.Title: “An okay place to stay but the elevators are definitely a problem”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1322
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip, as with every trip, I check out trip advisor. I had read that the food was over priced and the elevators were an issue. We stayed here from July 3 to July 8th. We did not have any issues checking in. A bellman took our luggage and let me keep my car in front of the hotel until I got our bags out and checked in. We chose to self park. The parking is extremely close. From the reviews I had read, it sounded like it was farther away but it is very close and very convenient and I don't see why you would need a valet. We were on the 4th floor and our room faced the pool. I thought the room was clean and well serviced and never had any issues at all. The main floor/ lobby of the hotel is renovated and very nice and they have a concierge who, when they are there, is very helpful. You can purchase Universal park tickets on site and they are knowledgeable about any deals or savings. We wanted to purchase tickets with cash but could only use credit card and the man was willing to put on his credit card and we would pay him the cash. We used our credit card but that was going out of his way I thought. There is a lounge right across from check in. Down farther on the main floor are computers for anyone's use. I think there are at least 6 computers available and I used them at different times during the day and never had to wait. The gift store has various items, from gifts to books to items you may need such as nail clippers (which we did). We had club service, so it was very nice to be able to go up in the morning and have some breakfast and h'ors doevres from 5 to 9 pm. Yes there is a charge for alcohol but soft drinks are free. The only problem with this hotel and it is a HUGE problem are the elevators. They are truly awful and I was so thankful to be on the fourth floor because you could walk down two flights of stair and be at the lobby. Lobby is 3rd floor. Just like everyone writes... they take FOREVER and A DAY. We checked in on a Sunday night and after we were settled, we wanted to go to the club level, floor 9 and check it out. The elevator was full of people. It was elevator #2... we were trying to get to 9 and it was like it was trying to understand the message of the floors but couldn't quite get there. It went to 9, stopped but didn't open, then went to 7, then back to 9 (not opening but acting like it may be thinking about it) went up to 10, down to 5 and then to 9 and finally opened. It was AWFUL. I have never been so close to thinking I was going to be stuck in an elevator. We got out right away. We chose to take the stairs down to the lobby to check it out more. When we went to go back to our room... there was a maintenance man talk to the elevator door saying, "OK sir, I have called the repair people and they will be here shortly" According to hotel staff, he was stuck in there for 45 minutes. They reassured my family member that it was all fixed. The next morning I was back in there and lucky for me, #2. I was trying to go to one of the top floors and the same thing happened. I never stepped foot in #2 again. The elevators never once took 90 seconds. I waited up to 15 minutes most times. They have seats outside the elevator, for a reason I believe. You really need to use them because the elevators take so long. We did have lunch one day in the restaurant and it was fine. There is a grocery store very close and we purchased some beverages and snacks. It costs $22 for two beer delivered room service which is crazy when you can go to the store and purchase more than two for cheaper then that. Loved the pool, loved the shuttle to Universal. Really easy to access and very friendly drivers. Does get quite full as it services more then just that hotel, so I had to stand once but all in all, it was easy and free! One day I was trying to rush and catch the shuttle and I could see it start to drive away and so I stopped running and my body language showed I was disappointed. The driver saw me and stopped and waited for us. So that was very nice. The worst part about the hotel is the elevators and I would not stay here again because of the elevators. Very scary. There are several comments about the elevators, so Sheraton needs to pay attention to that because it is a deal breaker in my opinion. Otherwise this is a fine place to stay. Just need to fix the elevators. Pillows and beds very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Universal and Hop on Hop Off Bus”
Reviews.Author: TartanTravellers07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 7 to 9 July. Booked via the internet 2 days before and got a deal which included parking, breakfast and universal tickets. Check in and check out was quick. Room was spacious and clean. Bed was extremely comfy. Buffet breakfast was very good. Service friendly. Free shuttle to Universal Studios but if you are able you are just as quick walking - 7-8 minutes. Can also get picked up here for free to take you to the pick up point (Chinese theatre) of the Hollywood loop of the Hop On Hop Off Bus tour - you can switch later to other loops. All in all we this hotel was very good and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If your thinking of staying here, please read this first (awful experience) ...............”
Reviews.Author: JasonLT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Universal hotel on 07/02/2011 â€“ 07/04/2001. The hotel stay was absolutely terrible. Please read on to see what you are in store for should you decide to stay at the Sheraton Universal. First of all, while checking in, the front desk clerk (Jason) failed to tell us about the evening hors dâ€™oeuvres service (not a big deal initially, but it set the precedence for this hotel stay). I knew about the Club Level because I reserved a Club Level room. However, this hotel has Club Level floors and Preferred Guest Level floors. Although the floors look identical, they are labeled differently when getting off of the elevator which leaves a guest who reserves a room on the Club Level floor to believe they are getting less value of a room by having to stay on the Preferred Guest Level floor. The hotel put us on the Preferred Level floor so it was confusing to the front desk clerk (looking at his computer) as to what amenities were available to us. I asked him 3 times after checking in and he kept telling me that if I wanted evening hors dâ€™oeuvres or breakfast, Iâ€™d have to go to the hotel restaurant (he kept looking at me as if I were trying to get a hotel service for free). This got me very confused and second guessed myself as to what level of room I had reserved. Next, most hotels offer complimentary beer and wine on the Club Level during the evening hors dâ€™oeuvres service. Not this hotel. And that is hotel, in the club reception room, there are bottles of 5 beers and 2 wines on display on the appetizer table. There are sodas and bottled water right next to the alcoholic beverages display. However, there is no mention of those alcoholic beverages costing anything. No sign, no announcement, nothing at all. Even when the hostess came by to take a drink order, there was no verbal mention that there would be a fee for the alcoholic beverages. Once the hostess brings you the beverage, she brings you a check with the alcoholic beverages on it (and expects a tip on top of that). Now, what is the point of paying extra for a club level room if they are even going to expect a tip? Although most hotels offer complimentary beverages, beer, and wine at the evening hors dâ€™oeuvres time, it is fine that this hotel does not. But at least inform the guest of such. Ok, so next problem. The elevator service is terrible. Before staying that this particular hotel, I read a review on this hotel that stated that the elevators took a guest 8 minutes to get from the ground floor to her room. After reading that, I thought to myself, â€œthat cannot possibly be true. What an exaggerationâ€�. However, on that particular review, the manager responded that he tested the elevator service and it should never take more than 90 seconds to hail an elevator. I thought, â€œthatâ€™s trueâ€�. However, believe it or not, that guest was correct! The first elevator trip to our floor after checking in took 13 minutes to arrive at the lobby level, not to mention a few additional minutes to get to our floor. The elevators could not handle the capacity of the guests, and once to capacity, seemed to bypass the lobby floor where the majority of guests were waiting to go to their rooms. If an elevator stopped at the lobby level, it was a miracle (and so crowded that only 1 or 2 guests could get into the elevator). I think the manager who responded to the previous guestâ€™s review about the elevators was testing the elevators out at 3:00am in the morning. Next, we arrived in our room and it was facing the freeway (obviously noisy as heck). I called to request a room change (mind you, this is at 6:00pm) and I was told that the hotel was sold out and there was nothing they could do. I was told that maybe there would be rooms available tomorrow (Saturday) so I politely said to let me know in the morning. The front desk clerk said I would have to call back in the morning and inquire. Ok, so one more thing for me to do? I asked if they could simply call me and they said Iâ€™d have to call them and re-inquire. A few minutes later, I called back and said I definitely needed a room change. I was told someone would call back in 5 minutes. 20 minutes later, I called back since no once had called me. I was told that they were still searching for rooms (mind you, there were still tons of guests checking into the hotel so what the big deal was about a room swap was beyond me). They finally called back and said the only room they could fit me into was a standard room on the third floor (not a Club Level room) that faced the hotel parking structure. And when I say faced it, I mean you look out the window and you literally see a concrete wall in front of you with a little cement entrance road below. How disgusting and certainly a slap in the face. Was it intentional, Iâ€™ll let you decide? Read on and youâ€™ll somehow agree that the culture of employees at this hotel are rude and not customer service oriented. So, we kept the room and moved on. We left for Universal City Walk at 8:00pm and stopped by the front desk on our way out. We spoke to the clerk who initially checked us in (Jason) and asked for a room refresh of towels and an evening turn down service. Jason looked up our room and stated he would take care of it. My wife even double confirmed the correct room number and Jason repeated our names back from the computer. So we thought we were set. Not so. We returned at midnight to find the room untouched. I called downstairs and was told there was no housekeeping staff on duty at midnight. Now come one, youâ€™d think a hotel this size would at least one housekeeper on duty. I asked for a manager and was told there was not a manager on duty until 9:00am the following morning. Are you serious? No manager. Who is in charge if the hotel was on fire? I was told that there absolutely was no manager on duty and there was absolutely nothing they could do. They sent a maintenance type employee up to our room with a stack of towels. Period. They stated that they would email a manager and he would contact us at 9:00am sharp the following morning. I simply got a voice mail message on our phone (which I did not get until we returned from Universal Studios the following day at 5:00pm). The message simply stated along the lines of said â€œHi, this is Chris Moraca, Front Desk Manager, I heard we had some issues last night. Please feel free to call me with any questionsâ€�. The next evening of our hotel stay (night 2), we left for the City Walk at about 6:30pm and called the front desk to request a room refreshing and turn down service again. They stated that there would be no problem with such a request. We returned at midnight to find the room untouched again. I called the front desk and was again told there was no housekeeping at that hour and no manager on duty. This is a Saturday night. What do you mean no manager on duty? It was the same front desk person I spoke to the previous evening (Leanne) and she could not believe what was happening. She apologized and stated that this was â€œcompletely unacceptableâ€� for this hotel to treat a guest in this manner. She promised to have a manager call my cell phone the following morning (of which I received no call from a manager or supervisor). Furthermore, Leanne stated that the manager that she was emailing that evening was Holly and that Holly would be the person contacting me in the morning. I told her we had no shampoo or soap left and had to get up very early the next morning for a flight. She said she would have the items brought right up to our room. Ten minutes later, my wife called and asked where the items were. It was 1:00am and we could not be hanging out waiting for the items because we needed to get to sleep for an early morning flight the next day. We were then told that the items were not on their way because there were other guests that needed attention first and we would have to â€œwait our turnâ€� in a line of requests. Finally, a hotel employee arrived again with a stack of towels and an entire bag for soap and shampoo. I mean, there had to be 20 bottles of mini shampoos and about 30 bars of soap. What point were they now trying to make? Finally, upon check out on Sunday morning (at 9:00am), there was one luggage valet available for approximately 7 â€“ 10 parties waiting for his services downstairs. Thank goodness we did not have to have a luggage valet come to our room. It would have never happened. We were getting a bit anxious that no one was able to assist us with calling for a taxi so we went back into the hotel and visited the concierge desk. We asked him to help us get a taxi. Although he was helping no one, he said only the bell desk could help us. Come to find out, all the bell desk needed to do is push a doorbell style button once which signaled a taxi to come to the lobby entrance to pick us up. Are you telling me that the concierge could not walk over a few steps and push said button (or at least tell us how to push the button)? It would have saved so much waiting time and energy. All in all, this hotel is poorly managed, lacks proper training, and a disgrace to the Sheraton name. I have never wrote a review on anything in my life as they are very time consuming. However, in this instance, I felt compelled to because I have never been treated this way. And to wrap it up, to this date, there has been no call from management to address the happenings during this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: Checking in was easy and everybody was friendly and helpful. Since we arrived early from Australia our room wasn't ready at 8am but the staff rushed around and were fantastic and let us in early, They could not have been more amazing, Bed was a great size and view was good, so close to walk up to city walk and having the blue line hop on hop off bus outside was AWESOME, Only downside the starbucks in lobby, could've been the worst coffee I have ever had, but can not fault Sheraton universal Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was near to Universal Studios. However, everything here you need to pay additional for, such as internet in room, breakfast, and parking ($18/day, with in-out privileges) They had a good number of computers where you can surf the web for free at their business center downstairs but it's usually full during peak times. Fortunately I was jetlagged so I was down there by 4am and nobody would be competing with me for the computers :-) They also had in-room starbucks coffee, and free newspapers at the business center. All in all, average / ok hotel, no wow factor, wouldn't recommend or NOT recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Blondie2846
Reviews.Content: Overall nice place. The bed is super comfy. The room and lobby are modern and updated. Everything feels very clean and new. The staff were very friendly. The food is so-so and overpriced. The gym is quite nice, but gets very crowded. There are 3 ellipticals, and 4 treadmills. I feel like they could fit in one more elliptical - since they were almost always full in the morning. But overall very impressed with the gym. Pool area is so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Fox0597
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a visit to Unversal Studios, this is a good hotel to stay at. It's about a 10 minute walk to get to Universal Studios or the Citywalk from the hotel. I recommend booking club level. You get light snacks in the evening and a light breakfast in the morning. Don't expect too much for breakfast...not hot items to eat. If you're looking for a good breakfast, you'll likley need to dine at the restaurant on lower level. If you're planning on using the gym, it's a decent set-up consiting of treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbells, and strength equipment. The only issue I had was the lack of airflow. The morning I worked out it was very hot and the A/C didn't seem to be working.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: OC_M_Lu
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to watch the Playboy Jazz Fest at the Hollywood Bowl and thought it would be great to stay at the Sheraton due to the close distance to the Bowl. Check-in was a breeze; they allowed me to check in at noon even if technically we had to wait till 3pm. I requested a room close to the elevators on a higher floor and they gave it to me without a hassle. The room had a flat screen tv, coffeemaker, safe, iron and 2 phones (wireless phone doesn't work-battery light was blinking). Major stain on the carpet very close to the window- gross. Another problem was the A/C didn't function so well. It didn't feel cold, it just felt like a strong fan all night. We sort of expected (half-hoped) that they would have a shuttle to the Bowl; unfortunately it wasn't one of the stops so we just cabbed it. By the way, self-parking is $18 per day and valet is $23. Props to the valet guys-very friendly and cheerful even if the weather outside was dreadful and gray on that saturday afternoon. We had breakfast the next morning at Americanas which is located on the terrace level overlooking the pool. It wasn't very busy so we were seated right away. The buffet breakfast didn't look too appetizing so we asked for the lunch and dinner menus and I ended up ordering off the dinner menu. My ribeye turned out just the way I want it and my bf enjoyed his spinach and egg white omelet. We asked for plain bagel, unfortunately, at 11am they ran out of plain bagel and served us raisin cinnamon bagel and charged us $2 for the cream cheese. WE had a so-so experience at the sheraton - nothing really fantastic stood out. Will we go back and stay there again? Probably not. Maybe we'll try the Hilton next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for work and play”
Reviews.Author: FlyNurse365
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay during my birthday weekend and then for work the rest of the week. Everything was crisp and clean. The housekeeping was great in respecting my privacy as well as having everything fresh. This hotel was a perfect distance from universal and staying away from the spotlight. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but super busy....”
Reviews.Author: yayalola
Reviews.Content: I went with my daughter last year. She was selected in a model contest and they sent us to this hotel. It's was nice and the location it's great. You can walk to the subway and walk to Universal if you are planning to go and have fun. The only problem was the elevator. If I Am not wrong they have 5 elevators. We waited forever....it's so busy this hotel that the average waiting to go up and down was 20 minutes ...We ended up using the stairs most of the time....but if you are in the 10 floor or up..I am not sure if you want to do that... The concierge was always busy too. It was only one person to ask for directions or suggestions....it is suuuuper crowded...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here and will return again”
Reviews.Author: shawniegirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the start of our honeymoon. Checking in was easy and everybody was friendly and helpful. Since we arrived early our room wasn't ready but the desk agent gave us a key to a lower room (no view) and said if we were okay we could have that room or else wait for our room with a view. Well since we were not there for the view we checked out the lower room and it was fine. We went back to the agent told him it was okay and so he upgraded us from that room to a low floor with the pool view which I thought was way better then the room we were supposed to have because this had a balcony. Also, since it was our honeymoon they gave us a comp breakfast coupon. The property is very nice as you would expect for a Sheraton. Location was perfect for going to Universal Studios. Short walk or you can catch their shuttle. Conciege desk was very helpful in giving us ideas for things to see along with maps on how to get there. The bell desk was helpful and valet parking guys were great and even wiped down our windows for us. I have no problems recommending this hotel to other and would gladly stay here again. If I had to find something negative to say I'd say it was finding our room the first time. To get to the lower level rooms you have to go down the hall (passing rooms) to an elevator. There is no sign on the outside saying elevator down the hall. So we walked down the hall as that was the directions given, saw rooms and figured it was the wrong way so turned around before getting to the elevator. Then after checking all areas we asked again and was told to pass the rooms to find the elevator. It wasn't bad just confusing and something to laugh about as we should have trusted the first directions.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: zev0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Universal for 2 nights in mid-April 2011 with my mother and young kids (aged 8 & 5). It was so close to Universal Studios! Absolutely fantastic. To get to Universal, you can cross the street & head into the parking garage to take the escalators all the way to the park entrance, or you can walk up the hill and cross the pedestrian bridge. The metro (subway) is just down the hill and across the street and it takes you right to the Chinese Theatre and Hollywood Walk of Fame. Perfect location. The beds were clean and our room was ready even though we arrived before lunch. Staff were friendly. The pool was nice but shady in the evening. I only had 3 negatives ~ (1) no fridge in the room (2) our room faced the road and freeway so it was very, very loud at night (2) the restaurant was very expensive for breakfast and nothing was open in Universal City....a staff recommended a family run restaurant which was cheap & great, but we had to walk a very long way to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch from the outset!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrianjaneb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a day before travelling. My husband booked over the phone via the reservation number. We didnt receive a confirmation email to confirn our booking, I heard him spell out our surname and i heard him spell out our email address not once but TWICE............ Check in - Because we didnt receive our confirmation number via email the lady we checked in with was very rude, if you dont have your confirmation number we can not help you, OUCH!!!!! eventually she found it after alot of huffing and puffing...... We had to pay for parking which is a total b........t cost after the price they charged for the room....... The room was very spacious considering we were travelling with a family of 5 (3 young kids). I dont even know if they had a restaurant as we didnt want to spend any additional money in the hotel after the service we received for reservation/check in. I mentioned this hotel to a friend of mine who was considering staying here and they immediately reconsidered another option. The only positive was it was close to Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rabrown420
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a really nice hotel! its a good location out of the city but still close enough to get downtown and the rooms themselves were very nice. There were a couple of issues we did have that were kinda a bummer to our weekend. First the Valet that was $28 a day was not the best...everytime we needed it we waited for someone to help us but during the waiting other couples would walk up and get helped right away...not so awesome! The other issue was that we were on the 20th floor and there was some sort of noise that sounded as if a pipe was being flushed out every 15 min or so...also a bit annoying. Both nights there were events taking place above our room and we never heard anything or were interupted by them but the second night one of the elevator floors was wet and i slipped and hurt my knee but i wastn going to let that damper our fun..we still had fun and it was a good weekend getaway but im not sure i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffery1
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Universal was a great hotel to stay at! My husband and I, along with a friend of ours booked 2 rooms for 2 nights so we we would be close to Universal Studios. We booked our rooms through Priceline (after shopping different sites and even calling the hotel itself) and got the best deal. When we arrived we found that our 2 rooms were on different floors, which wasn't that big of a deal - but the wonderful woman at the check-in desk went out of her way to find us 2 rooms on the same floor, that were right across the hall from each other. We meant to go back and get her name but we never saw her again. Just about everything to do with the hotel was wonderful. -The rooms were very clean (and we got a view of the park) -The bathrooms were clean and the water pressure was great! - There was a coffee pot in the room with STARBUCKS coffee and Tazo tea! a HUGE deal to me. -The entire staff was great! The valet people in the front were so nice! They joked around with us when we were coming in and leaving and helped us with walking directions (and we didn't valet, we just parked in the garage, but they were nice and helpful anyway and always smiling). - The people who worked the desk were friendly and helpful - Room service was speedy and our order was right. :) - The hotel is right across the street from Universal Studios and down the block from the subway station (which we walked to so we could catch the train to downtown and go shopping, see the walk of fame etc. etc and the Hollywood sign is visible from the Mall if you go to the top floor). -Housekeeping was great (we left them $5 a day - you should always tip everyday because you might get a different housekeeper at the end of your stay so if you tip only when you check out, you may have stiffed the person that cleaned your room most of your stay!) -There is a bar in the lobby which was great after a day walking around and also a convenience store in case you forgot anything -There is an outdoor pool, which we didn't use, but it looked nice clean (our friend had a view of the pool and the hills) -The overall hotel was clean and well maintained. We would definitely stay here again. Not only are you close to Universal and the Subway, but you are a short drive or cab ride to lots of other attractions. The ONLY bad thing we encountered in the hotel, and this only applies to my husband and I, not our friend, who had no issues whatsoever.... was that in the middle of the night our air-conditioner stopped working! The fan was going but warm air was blowing out... we both woke up very hot and the room was very very stuffy. It was the last day of our stay and it was the middle of the night - it wan't that big of a deal (although it was a little hard to sleep) so we didn't bother calling the front desk. The room was back to normal when we woke up and then we were checking out anyway. No biggie. I'm sure if we would have called someone, it would have been fixed in no time. But that's it... just one little tiny issue that did not ruin my vacation. :) We had a great time and we will be back! Oh and for those out there that complain about having to pay to park - good luck finding a decent hotel in California where you don't have to pay. We didn't mind having to pay to park - your car is in a nice garage, guard gated and it's right next to the hotel - no problems getting in or out, and once you pay, you can come and go all day long if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool0879
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for access to universal studios and all the highways. Was also only a 5 min downhill walk to the subway so that you can access all the sights of LA. The staff were very helpful and helped us to book lots of trips and visits and were always quick with advice and tips so that we had a brilliant 6 day stay in LA and feel we saw everything there was to see

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smoke free, hotel, definately not”
Reviews.Author: willowMelbourne
Reviews.Content: One of my daughters is Asthmatic, and i would never return to this hotel, with her. Though the rooms are meant to be smoke free, they smell of smoke, admitedly not as much as the corridor or entrance area, so if a smoke free environment is necessary this is not the hotel for you. Its close proximety to Universal Studios was our reason for booking, unfortunately it did not live up to our expectations, as the sheets were torn or stained and the water did hot flow down the plug hole but built up in the bath. The restaurant is worth mentioning, food was great, the staff were attentive and listened to our needs. I do recommend eating here rather then at Universal. I also appreciated the Bell staff, their sunny but professional approach, and care they took with our baggage, was exemplery.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, clean, touristy”
Reviews.Author: MissMockingbird
Reviews.Content: This was probably our 5th stay at this hotel, over a 8 year period. In the past few years they've re-branded this hotel as "the hotel of the stars" or something stupid like that and it has become much more touristy. That's ok. The location is excellent, easy access from the freeways and if you're into the tourist stuff Universal City Walk is within walking distance. We go to LA to visit family. So, I'd just as soon not be in the tourist mess but really it's worth it for this hotel. It's clean. It's nice. There is pretty much always someone on staff at the front desk. You can get a great deal on this hotel on Hotwire if you know how to recognize it in their system. That's what we do. It's listed as 4-star but I would call it a very solid 3.5 star, not a 4 star. Without the Hotwire rate I think it's still a great place to stay but I probably wouldn't stay there paying full price. I did once and it was over $1000 for 5 days. Maybe that's ok with you, and if so, you're going to really like this hotel. They have food, a bar, and a gift shop. I only have 3 complaints and they're fairly minor: 1) They use a flat sheet in place of a fitted sheet. For me, a person who rolls around a lot while sleeping, that meant that every night I ended up sleeping on a bare mattress since the flat sheets just wont stay on the bed if you move much. 2) They charge $18/day for parking. I think that's a lot considering that pretty much every person who visits LA gets a car. But, there's no place else to park. So, we pay it. 3) They can have long lines at check-in and just one guy working that desk. We unfortunately arrived just after their airport shuttle and had to wait about 1/2 hour to check in as all the folks from the shuttle were ahead of us. I think the hotel should bring an extra couple of people to do check-in when their shuttle arrives. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you want to see Universal City.

Reviews.Title: “The Elevators and Thin Walls will make you crazy”
Reviews.Author: KGolf14
Reviews.Content: Just spent nine nights at the Sheraton Universal. Part of my trip was planned , part was due to a family emergency. The front desk , valet and bar lounge staff was very helpful and attentive but the rest of my hotel experience was very disappointing. Several days I waited over 20 minutes for the elevator. My first night the voices, noises and smoke from the room next store made it impossible to sleep. Most nights I heard all the conversations going on in the room next store. I am a Starwood Elite Vacation Owner and an avid Starwood user. This will be my last stay at this Hotel. I would rather stay at the Westin at Lax or a hotel near Burbank.

Reviews.Title: “mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: travelling1935
Reviews.Content: I have stayed occasionally at the Sheraton Universal over the years, and I have to say that in spite of recent substantial renovations, the hotel is feeling a bit tired. On my last two-night visit, I was on a high floor with spectacular views, and had a comfortable night's sleep on a most comfortable bed. The check-in was pleasant and attentive. Questions were answered knowledgably and courteously. The lobby was as attractive as I always remembered it, but with no real sitting area unless you went into the bar section. The decor in soft beige tints was pleasant both upstairs and down. Self-parking was good value at $18 per 24 hours, as was the internet. Yet, there was also a motor hotel feel feel which was new and unwelcome. The room maintenance was bizarre in my case. It was no more than perfunctory, if that. After my first night I returned to the room after several hours away and found that the bed covers had simply been pulled up â€” and not much more. Dust balls on the carpet evident when I checked in were still there 24 hours later. In the bathroom, I had left one towel in the tub because it needed replacing. When I returned it was now on the bathroom floor, along with the bath mat which I had carefully folded and draped over the tub in the morning. There was soap scum in the wash basin. Also. I suspect that easy access to restaurants up the hill on City Walk has had a negative effect on food services at the Sheraton Universal. Again, the staff in the sole remaining restaurant was pleasant and attentive, although not especially professional. But it was essentially a coffee-shop menu and coffee-shop quality food. However, the tortilla soup can be recommended. For breakfast, unless you want a traditional repast, the coffee and Danish bar in the bar area is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Still as BAD”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not good the last time we stayed, some 4 years ago. Well it is now even worse. Plumbing not working, both sink and toilet not flowing away. It took 11 hours for the engineer to attend to these small matters. Very noisy maids trolleys going along at 5.30am, and maid service that would do justice to the average prison. Yes the beds are very comfortable but with all the noise what is the point. Next trip it will be up the hill to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: chrisoula1962
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great staff....................most comfortable bed everrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr 5 minute walk to Universal studios, 10 minute walk to metro and then the world is your oyster...............highly recommended and value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great place - old hotel, but in nice shape”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelCoord
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days last month and enjoyed it- The hotel seemed to be well maintained, and the staff was very professional and helpful. The Concierge was able to make dinner recommendation for restaurants NOT on the City Walk, and the bellmen were always ready to help any way they could. Two people made my stay extra special; the housekeeper on my floor who lit up each morning I passed her and wanted to know how I was doing, and the Club Room attendant at breakfast, who wanted to make sure I had everything I could possible want for breakfast. On my last day, the Club Room attendant said she was going to miss me, and hoped I would be back soon. I hope so! The bar also makes a great mojito! The other selections are very good as well. The only down sides were: The hotel restaurant. The menu looks like it came from the "My First Restaurant" kit: Salmon, steak, chicken, Caesar salad... The food tasted very basic as well. And the parking- about 20 bucks a day!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel for Universal Studios trip”
Reviews.Author: Norgetroll
Reviews.Content: Lat stayed here two years ago. Hotel is still IMO the best play when visiting Universal Studios. The park is in walking distance and the hotel shuttle runs daily from 9am to 8pm. We never waited for more than 5 minutes . Hotel staff are very friendly. Plenty of bell men to get your bags. No line at check in, arrived at 8pm. We ate in the bar area, which is generally quiet. food was tasty and service friendly. We were in room on 10 floor. View of pool and hills. 2 queens with a sitting area. Perfect size for family of 4. Decor was nice and room very clean. Had Club privaliges. This is the only area we noticed any changes.Breakfast was fine but not as good as last time. The small single juice bottles in several varities were gone. Instead just a large Orange juice pitcher. No more single serve cereals and strawberries were only put out once. Evening service like wise was scaled back. Some veggies, dip, and chicken wings. Pool area is nice, with plenty of chairs and towels. The pool though is not heated, which made it impossible to swim in. Internet is still not free. $.9.99 a day. And self park is $18 a day. Still a nice hotel and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated except corners”
Reviews.Author: SKW66
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their cheapest King bed room for around $100 booked through Hotwire. Pros: - Received really nice service from the bell boy (man, actually) who showed genuine friendliness that made us feel that he really wanted us to have a pleasant stay from his heart. When he found that we were staying for 10 days, he offered to bring us a mini-fridge just in case. It's complementary anyway, but his service was really superb. Too bad I am not good at remembering names that I could have given him credits here. - 70% of the hotel had been renovated. E.g. wall papers, bedside cabinets, etc. - Couldn't request for a King bed room before arrival and hence we could only use a room in the same floor of the front desk. But since the hotel's big and the room was located furthest from the front desk, we did not find this much of a concern at all. - Computers in the business center were all new models (new at least to a computer idiot like me) with speedy internet. Before we arrived, we read the earlier review saying that the computers in the business center were not working properly. But during the 10 days of our stay, we did not see any of this happened and made good use of them. So it was still fine without free in-room wi-fi. - They offered $5 voucher each day we declined housekeeping service. Hence we'd collected vouchers worth a total of $30. We used them all at one go and enjoyed a breakfast in the hotel on the last day. (Though don't expect too much on the food...) Cons: - The only 2 mirrors in the room were located inconveniently. The biggest one was in the bathroom but there was no way I could lean closer to look at my face clearly as the bathroom was really small. Another mirror was located inside the closet. Since we have 4 big luggages, one of them was put inside the side right in front of the mirror ('cause no where else in the room could we have put it instead). And with the dim lighting next to the closet, it was still hard for me to try to put some make-up on. And we had been wondering why the mirror was not placed behind the working desk where there was a really big empty wall. - While every thing seemed to be pretty new, spider's web was found in the ceiling corner in the bedroom. Mold was also found at the ceiling corner at the bath tub. And the door lock was obviously not replaced after renovation and looked quite dirty and old. - Is it how the blankets are arranged in hotels now? We have a thick bed cover over a down blanket over a thin bed sheet. All these 3 items are just loosely covering in layers without any thing holding them together. Every morning the 3 blankets went different paths and it was really not comfortable to find yourself directly covered by the down blanket when you woke up in the morning. - With a flat screen TV already in place, the hotel at a level like Sheraton should really consider incorporating the HD features. - Traveling to Universal Studio/ City Walk from the hotel was not meant to be done by walk. Either you catch the shuttle or drive there yourself. We wanted to watch a movie past 8pm at one night but the shuttle was already off. We had to pay $10 for parking in the City Walk while we were supposed to be staying in the hotel at Universal Studio.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton strives to deliver the best service - And it does!”
Reviews.Author: chriscoolio
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel review I've ever written - the reason I'm writing this is because the Sheraton has delivered exceptional service to my family and me. I woke up early this morning because I was thinking about the daunting task of complaining to the front desk about an issue that was bothering me. When I finally plucked up the courage to go to the front desk, I was met by Max, who greeted me with a warm welcome. I told him my complaint and he surprised me by saying "well, we will look into that because we want to make you a happy customer". I was so surprised because although making customers happy should be the main goal of every service company, it is rare that that is the top of mind of the person helping the customer. There was no arguing with me, no disagreeing or push back - Max simply said he would take care of it. I felt comfort after this and I did not even tell him that I was actually planning to ask for a refund for the remaining 3 nights I am to stay here. Max raised my issue with the manager, solved my problem, and even threw in free wifi for my troubles- he converted me from an angry customer to a loyal one. I am very happy now and i look forward to my next three nights here in the Sheraton - Thanks Max! Other comments: -all standard rooms have no fridge. I called room services and they brought one up free of charge -rooms are renovated and clean -beds are super comfortable -$18 self parking fee for over night parking (lot is conveniently close to hotel elevator)

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: peteleedds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 evenings. Front desk, bell hop were not friendly at all. Ordered room service four times but they did not get my order right 3 times. Ordered an omelette, but no salt or pepper. Called room service to complain, their response, "you never mentioned salt and pepper." Ordered coffee, but only got a mug. Was told internet service was free, called before to make sure. I was then charged $9.95 ten times. I used valet parked for one day only but I was charged for 4! Was annoyed by the noise caused by the ice machine next to my door. Never got a good night's sleep. Called customer service to complain about these charges but agent kept putting me on hold. Then got transferred to accounting department but no response. No call back. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and Still Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: stevelieb
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent corporate business traveler, I really look for comfort and service when I am away from home and my family. This is my second recent stay at the Sheraton Universal, and I am still convinced that this is a great property. The aromatherapy scent that is common in all Starwood properties greets you when you enter the lobby. I was upgraded to a nice sized room with a king bed on the Club floor. The room was freezing cold when I checked in, but when I called the operator a hotel engineer contacted me immediately. He came upstairs and got the heater working-I just wish I remembered his name because he was very professional and made sure I was satisfied with the situation before he left. The 9th floor lounge is well appointed and offers an evening reception with beer and wine for sale, along with light appetizers as well as a free continental breakfast in the morning. After getting caught up on emails, I was not motivated to leave the hotel for dinner and ate downstairs in the restaurant. While nothing on the menu jumped out at me, the chicken with tossed parmesan asparagus was delicious. I look forward to returning on my next trip down the coast.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd or 3rd visit to this property and my first since the renovation. Even as a repeat visitor, it's hard to find the entrance to this hotel. Staff check in was fast and friendly. I was upgraded to an "Executive" room which was basically a large junior suite. The room had nice/new Sheraton furnishings, but the new-ish flatscreen tv was way too small for the room/the way it was positioned (too far from the bed or sofa to see). The main problem with the hotel in the guest room as well as in the Terrace Room where I attended a cocktail reception was the lack of functioning A/C. I think the management is aware of this issue (as evidenced by the fan placed in the room at check in). The room wasn't terrible, but the ballroom was unbearable. People were sweating in their gowns and suits and constantly stepping out to breathe. Room service was fast and delicious. The lobby bar was a great place to catch up with an old friend. Good beers on tap, great cocktails, good service. Valet was fast. The only other problem (potentially a deal breaker if you're here on vacation) is that the elevators were woefully below the hotel's capacity. I'd wait 5-10 minutes on average. (To be fair, there were 2 events in the hotel and it was a busy Saturday night) but a trip to/from your room shouldn't take 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Staff and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jetski579
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in January 2011 for 4 nights. Rooms were immaculate and large. Saved a bit and went for a single room with 2 queen beds for wife, 2 boys, and myself. Room was clean, bathroom was spotless, staff were courteous. Everything was just right in this hotel. Stayed with spg combinations.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to Universal”
Reviews.Author: fhata
Reviews.Content: Booked a AAA Travel package to the Sheraton Universal for two nights. We arrived just before noon and was able to check into a room right away. The service was great with our bellman offering a free fridge for all of our snacks/drinks that we brought. Parking for our car was included in the package, but runs around $18.00 for self parking. The room was located on the 17th floor with a nice view of the park. Although small, our accomodations seemed recently remodeled and clean. We quickly unpacked and headed to the park. By foot, you first take an elevator up to the next level (where the Hilton is) and then take a short uphill hike to the park. Total time about 15 minutes. There is a shuttle that picks up at the Sheraton but we never used it. Universal was not packed during our stay, and we easily covered everything in the two days. One evening we took the Metro to Hollywood/Highland (one stop from Universal Station) to see the Graumans Chinese Theater and the sights. On the return trip back to Universal Station there is a bit of an uphill walk to the Sheraton. It seemed safe as there were others walking. The next morning we decided to try their buffet breakfast downstairs and it was one of the best buffets we've had in a long time. Although not cheap (around $25.00/person) we enjoyed the breakfast faire. The big breakfast precluded us from eating much in the park that day until we had dinner that evening. That evening we spent at the City Walk next to the park. The recent acquisition of the Sheraton Universal by the Shenzhen group may bring some interesting changes to the Hotel. As a Starwood member we would definitely consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A little frustrating”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: Was here on business for 2 nights, a few observations. The outside looks like nothing special but the inside has been redone. TMy first thought was that it looked pretty good. But... The pluses: - All staff were extremely friendly, at all times. - It is located within walking distance of Universal Studios and City Walk (but there's a shuttle anyway as some of the walk is uphill). - The hotel has an area with a number of computers for free use, including internet access. - hotel was quiet. The negatives: - The computer centre was not working 9 out of my 10 trips to it. When I finally mentioned it at the Front Desk, they were nice but completely unconcerned and it was never fixed for the rest of my stay. I saw others get up and leave the computer centre in frustration. - My 'recently renovated' CLUB floor room had stains everywhere - on the bed, on the drapes, on the literature. - room had plastic cups - no fridge or mini-bar (I really felt this was odd considering I was on the club floor) - The pay per view movies on the tv would not come up. - Could not access the "current account balance" - ever. - The restaurant closes before 6:30, leaving only the bar area on the main floor. The bar area is nice, the staff are great, but I thought the food was awful. - Conceirge gave me incorrect information (I was told a shuttle to the airport is $20.00...ah, I wish). - Bill was incorrect at check out and I had to get manager's assistance to straighten it out (completely their error - they were apologetic but the mistake was so unncessary). Keep in mind this hotel is not a cab ride from the airport (that's over $100.00). So you should rent a vehicle. It's too bad, with a little work and attention to detail, this could be a great place. I plan to take my family to Universal Studios soon, but I will be staying at the Hilton right next door. I didn't get a chance to visit it, but something tells me it's got to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing service”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: As flights from Australia arrive into LAX early in the morning, I contacted the hotel quite a while in advance and requested early check in. We booked 3 rooms and requested them all to be together. I communicated with a lovely man from the hotel before our trip and he sounded so positive and helpful. Of course upon arrival (with 4 feral children!) NONE of our rooms were ready and the receptionist didn't try to help us at all. A very dissapointing arrival. The rooms however are lovely and the beds are extremely comfortable. During our 3 days we never saw the shuttle bus to Universal Studios and this was a huge problem as I have multiple sclerosis. The walk is just too far and difficult (for anyone really!). Taxi drivers got really annoyed at us because the drive was too short. The Hilton is definately closer and an easier walk. Next time I would stay there as it is much more convenient. I wish other reviewers mentioned that! It is definately worth getting the club lounge as the continental breakfast is lovely and fresh. I would also like to mention that I left a US$250 brand new tracksuit on the bed as I left. I was silly to not check the room before I left. There were kids running around and we were running late so it's my fault. We phoned the hotel 1 hour later and were put through to lost property. They found nothing. We phoned again the next day and spoke to reception and lost property again - once again, nothing. Very sad that someone would find it and keep it.
